member.name: T:Aspose.Words.TextColumn
member.summary:
Represents a single text column. is a member of the collection. The collection includes all the columns in a section of a document.
To learn more, visit the Working with Sections documentation article.

remarks.p: objects are only used to specify columns with custom width and spacing. If you want the columns in the document to be of equal width, set TextColumns. to true.
When a new is created it has its width and spacing set to zero.

member.dev: This is both a presentation and a model class. Represents width and spacing of a single column in a section. Only used for custom width columns (not for evenly spaced columns).

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.TextColumn.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the text column in points.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.TextColumn.SpaceAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets the space between this column and the next column in points. Not required for the last column.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection
member.summary:
A collection of objects that represent all the columns of text in a section of a document.
To learn more, visit the Working with Sections documentation article.

remarks.p: Use to set the number of text columns.
To make all columns equal width and spaced evenly, set to true and specify the amount of space between the columns in . MS Word will automatically calculate column widths.
If you have set to false, you need to specify width and spacing for each column individually. Use the indexer to access individual objects.
When using custom column widths, make sure the sum of all column widths and spacings between them equals page width minus left and right page margins.

member.dev: This is a pure presentation class. Does not store any model data, just provides friendly access to section attributes that are related to managing text columns.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection.SetCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Arranges text into the specified number of text columns.

remarks.p: When is false and you increase the number of columns, new objects are created with zero width and spacing. You need to set width and spacing for the new columns.

member.param: The number of columns the text is to be arranged into.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection.EvenlySpaced
member.summary: True if text columns are of equal width and evenly spaced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection.Spacing
member.summary: When columns are evenly spaced, gets or sets the amount of space between each column in points.
member.remarks: Has effect only when is set to true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection.Width
member.summary: When columns are evenly spaced, gets the width of the columns.

remarks.p: Has effect only when is set to true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection.LineBetween
member.summary: When true, adds a vertical line between columns.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of columns in the section of a document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a text column at the specified index.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Style
member.summary:
Represents a single built-in or user-defined style.
To learn more, visit the Working with Styles and Themes documentation article.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Style.Remove
member.summary: Removes the specified style from the document.
member.remarks:
Style removal has following effects on the document model:
All references to the style are removed from corresponding paragraphs, runs and tables.
If base style is removed its formatting is moved to child styles.
If style to be deleted has a linked style, then both of these are deleted.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Style.Equals(Aspose.Words.Style)
member.summary: Compares with the specified style. Styles Istds are compared for built-in styles only. Styles defaults are not included in comparison. Base style, linked style and next paragraph style are recursively compared.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Style.Equals(Aspose.Words.Style,Aspose.Collections.Generic.HashSetGeneric{Aspose.Pair})
member.summary: Compares with the specified style considering base, linked and next paragraph styles. Uses HashSet to check already compared styles to avoid dead loops in linked and next styles.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Style.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the style.

remarks.p: Can not be empty string.
If there already is a style with such name in the collection, then this style will override it. All affected nodes will reference new style.

member.summary: Gets the locale independent style identifier for a built-in style.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.StyleCollection
member.summary:
A collection of objects that represent both the built-in and user-defined styles in a document.
To learn more, visit the Working with Styles and Themes documentation article.
member.dev: At the moment the styles are identified by istd (style index) that never changes (it only changes when importing a style from another document). Will it be better if I used a string name as an identifier? Note however, it should not change once it has been assigned, otherwise will need to update all references to the style in the model.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.StyleCollection.ClearQuickStyleGallery
member.summary: Removes all styles from the Quick Style Gallery panel.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.StyleCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets an enumerator object that will enumerate styles in the alphabetical order of their names.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.StyleCollection.Add(Aspose.Words.StyleType,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new user defined style and adds it the collection.

remarks.p: You can create character, paragraph or a list style.
When creating a list style, the style is created with default numbered list formatting (1 \ a \ i).
Throws an exception if a style with this name already exists.

member.param: A value that specifies the type of the style to create.
Case sensitive name of the style to create.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.StyleCollection.Add(Aspose.Words.Style)
member.summary: Adds the style to the collection of styles.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.StyleCollection.AddCopy(Aspose.Words.Style)
member.summary: Copies a style into this collection.
member.param: Style to be copied.
member.returns: Copied style ready for usage.

remarks.para: Style to be copied can belong to the same document as well as to different document.
Linked style is copied.
This method does doesn't copy base styles.

If collection already contains a style with the same name, then new name is automatically generated by adding "_number" suffix starting from 0 e.g. "Normal_0", "Heading 1_1" etc. Use setter for changing the name of the imported style.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.StyleCollection.AddCopy(Aspose.Words.Style,Aspose.Words.ImportContext)
member.summary: Copies a style into this collection.
member.remarks: The can be null, if we are not in importing process. Otherwise, if importing in mode, then direct formatting of the style will not be collapsed over destination attributes, as it happens in the usual way.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.StyleCollection.Document
member.summary: Gets the owner document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.StyleCollection.DefaultFont
member.summary: Gets document default text formatting.

remarks.p: Note that document-wide defaults were introduced in Microsoft Word 2007 and are fully supported in OOXML formats () only. Earlier document formats have limited support for this feature and only font names can be stored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.StyleCollection.DefaultParagraphFormat
member.summary: Gets document default paragraph formatting.

remarks.p: Note that document-wide defaults were introduced in Microsoft Word 2007 and are fully supported in OOXML formats () only. Earlier document formats have no support for document default paragraph formatting.

member.dev: Default paragraph formatting is copied to all top level styles when it is not supported in target document format.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.StyleCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of styles in the collection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.StyleCollection.Item(System.String)
member.overloads: Retrieves a style from the collection.
member.summary: Gets a style by name or alias.

remarks.p: Case sensitive, returns null if the style with the given name is not found.
If this is an English name of a built in style that does not yet exist, automatically creates it.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.StyleCollection.Item(Aspose.Words.StyleIdentifier)
member.summary: Gets a built-in style by its locale independent identifier.

remarks.p: When accessing a style that does not yet exist, automatically creates it.

member.param: A value that specifies the built in style to retrieve.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.StyleCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a style by index.
member.dev: Gets by index, not by istd.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Comment
member.summary:
Represents a container for text of a comment.
To learn more, visit the Working with Comments documentation article.

remarks.para: A comment is an annotation which is anchored to a region of text or to a position in text. A comment can contain an arbitrary amount of block-level content.
If a object occurs on its own, the comment is anchored to the position of the object.
To anchor a comment to a region of text three objects are required: , and . All three objects need to share the same value.
remarks.p: is an inline-level node and can only be a child of .
can contain and child nodes.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Comment.#ctor(Aspose.Words.DocumentBase,Aspose.Words.RunPr)
member.summary: Main ctor used internally.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Comment.#ctor(Aspose.Words.DocumentBase)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.p: When is created, it belongs to the specified document, but is not yet part of the document and is null.
To append to the document use or on the paragraph where you want the comment inserted.
remarks.para: After creating a comment, don't forget to set its , and properties.

member.param: The owner document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Comment.#ctor(Aspose.Words.DocumentBase,System.String,System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The owner document.
The author name for the comment. Cannot be null.
The author initials for the comment. Cannot be null.
The date and time for the comment.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Comment.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on .
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the nodes.
member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.
member.remarks: Calls , then calls for all child nodes of the comment and calls at the end.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Comment.AddReply(System.String,System.String,System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a reply to this comment.
member.param: The author name for the reply.
The author initials for the reply.
The date and time for the reply.
The reply text.
member.returns: The created node for the reply.
member.remarks: Due to the existing MS Office limitations only 1 level of replies is allowed in the document. An exception of type will be raised if this method is called on the existing Reply comment.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Comment.RemoveReply(Aspose.Words.Comment)
member.summary: Removes the specified reply to this comment.
member.remarks: All constituent nodes of the reply will be deleted from the document.
member.param: The comment node of the deleting reply.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Comment.RemoveAllReplies
member.summary: Removes all replies to this comment.
member.remarks: All constituent nodes of the replies will be deleted from the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Comment.SetText(System.String)
member.summary: This is a convenience method that allows to easily set text of the comment.

remarks.para: This method allows to quickly set text of a comment from a string. The string can contain paragraph breaks, this will create paragraphs of text in the comment accordingly. If you want to insert more complex elements into the comment, for example bookmarks or tables or apply rich formatting, then you need to use the appropriate node classes to build up the comment text.

member.param: The new text of the comment.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Comment.NodeType
member.summary: Returns .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Comment.StoryType
member.summary: Returns .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Comment.Id
member.summary: Gets the comment identifier.

remarks.para: The comment identifier allows to anchor a comment to a region of text in the document. The region must be demarcated using the and object sharing the same identifier value as the object.
You would use this value when looking for the and nodes that are linked to this comment.
Comment identifiers are supposed to be unique across a document and Aspose.Words automatically maintains comment identifiers when loading, saving and combining documents.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Comment.Initial
member.summary: Returns or sets the initials of the user associated with a specific comment.

remarks.para: Cannot be null.
Default is empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Comment.DateTime
member.summary: Gets the date and time that the comment was made.

remarks.para: Default is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Comment.Author
member.summary: Returns or sets the author name for a comment.

remarks.para: Cannot be null.
Default is empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Comment.Ancestor
member.summary: Returns the parent object. Returns null for top-level comments.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Comment.Replies
member.summary: Returns a collection of objects that are immediate children of the specified comment.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Comment.Done
member.summary: Gets or sets flag indicating that the comment has been marked done.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.ControlChar
member.summary:
Control characters often encountered in documents.
To learn more, visit the Working With Control Characters documentation article.
member.remarks: Provides both char and string versions of the same constants. For example: string and char have the same value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.CellChar
member.summary: End of a table cell or end of a table row character: (char)7 or "\a".

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.TabChar
member.summary: Tab character: (char)9 or "\t".

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.LineFeedChar
member.summary: Line feed character: (char)10 or "\n".

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.LineBreakChar
member.summary: Line break character: (char)11 or "\v".

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.PageBreakChar
member.summary: Page break character: (char)12 or "\f".

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.SectionBreakChar
member.summary: End of section character: (char)12 or "\f".

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.ParagraphBreakChar
member.summary: End of paragraph character: (char)13 or "\r".

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.ColumnBreakChar
member.summary: End of column character: (char)14.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.FieldStartChar
member.summary: Start of MS Word field character: (char)19.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.FieldSeparatorChar
member.summary: Field separator character separates field code from field value. Optional in some fields. Value: (char)20.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.FieldEndChar
member.summary: End of MS Word field character: (char)21.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.NonBreakingHyphenChar
member.summary: Nonbreaking Hyphen in Microsoft Word is (char)30.

remarks.p: Nonbreaking Hyphen in Microsoft Word does not correspond to the Unicode character U+2011 non-breaking hyphen but instead represents internal information that tells Microsoft Word to display a hyphen and not to break a line.
Useful info: http://www.cs.tut.fi/~jkorpela/dashes.html#linebreaks.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.OptionalHyphenChar
member.summary: Optional Hyphen in Microsoft Word is (char)31.

remarks.p: Optional Hyphen in Microsoft Word does not correspond to the Unicode character U+00AD soft hyphen. Instead, it inserts internal information that tells Word about a possible hyphenation point.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.SpaceChar
member.summary: Space character: (char)32.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.NonBreakingSpaceChar
member.summary: Non-breaking space character: (char)160.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.ControlChar.DefaultTextInputChar

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Font
member.summary:
Contains font attributes (font name, font size, color, and so on) for an object.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fonts documentation article.

remarks.p: You do not create instances of the class directly. You just use to access the font properties of the various objects such as , , , .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Font.ClearFormatting
member.summary: Resets to default font formatting.

remarks.p: Removes all font formatting specified explicitly on the object from which was obtained so the font formatting will be inherited from the appropriate parent.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Font.HasDmlEffect(Aspose.Words.TextDmlEffect)
member.summary: Checks if particular DrawingML text effect is applied.
member.param: DrawingML text effect type.
member.returns: true if particular DrawingML text effect is applied.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Font.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the font.

remarks.p: When getting, returns .
When setting, sets , , and to the specified value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Font.NameAscii
member.summary: Returns or sets the font used for Latin text (characters with character codes from 0 (zero) through 127).

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Font.NameBi
member.summary: Returns or sets the name of the font in a right-to-left language document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Font.NameFarEast
member.summary: Returns or sets an East Asian font name.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Font.NameOther
member.summary: Returns or sets the font used for characters with character codes from 128 through 255.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Font.ThemeFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the theme font in the applied font scheme that is associated with this object.

dev.p: When getting, returns depending on character category of the text.
When setting, sets , , and to the specified value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Font.ThemeFontAscii
member.summary: Gets or sets the theme font used for Latin text (characters with character codes from 0 (zero) through 127) in the applied font scheme that is associated with this object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Font.ThemeFontFarEast
member.summary: Gets or sets the East Asian theme font in the applied font scheme that is associated with this object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Font.ThemeFontOther
member.summary: Gets or sets the theme font used for characters with character codes from 128 through 255 in the applied font scheme that is associated with this object.

Setting this property for object with non-theme colors results in a .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Font.AutoColor
member.summary: Returns the present calculated color of the text (black or white) to be used for 'auto color'. If the color is not 'auto' then returns .

remarks.p: When text has 'automatic color', the actual color of text is calculated automatically so that it is readable against the background color. As you change the background color, the text color will automatically switch to black or white in MS Word to maximize legibility.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Font.Bidi
member.summary: Specifies whether the contents of this run shall have right-to-left characteristics.

remarks.para: This property, when on, shall not be used with strongly left-to-right text. Any behavior under that condition is unspecified. This property, when off, shall not be used with strong right-to-left text. Any behavior under that condition is unspecified.

When the contents of this run are displayed, all characters shall be treated as complex script characters for formatting purposes. This means that , , and a corresponding font name will be used when rendering this run.
Also, when the contents of this run are displayed, this property acts as a right-to-left override for characters which are classified as "weak types" and "neutral types".

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.InlineStory
member.summary:
Base class for inline-level nodes that can contain paragraphs and tables.
To learn more, visit the Logical Levels of Nodes in a Document documentation article.

remarks.p: is a container for block-level nodes and .
The classes that derive from are inline-level nodes that can contain their own text (paragraphs and tables). For example, a node contains text of a comment and a contains text of a footnote.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Paragraph
member.summary:
Represents a paragraph of text.
To learn more, visit the Working with Paragraphs documentation article.

remarks.p: is a block-level node and can be a child of classes derived from or .
can contain any number of inline-level nodes and bookmarks.
The complete list of child nodes that can occur inside a paragraph consists of , , , , , , , , , , , , .

A valid paragraph in Microsoft Word always ends with a paragraph break character and a minimal valid paragraph consists just of a paragraph break. The class automatically appends the appropriate paragraph break character at the end and this character is not part of the child nodes of the , therefore a can be empty.
Do not include the end of paragraph or end of cell characters inside the text of the paragraph as it might make the paragraph invalid when the document is opened in Microsoft Word.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Paragraph.#ctor(Aspose.Words.DocumentBase)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.p: When is created, it belongs to the specified document, but is not yet part of the document and is null.
To append to the document use or on the story where you want the paragraph inserted.

member.param: The owner document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Paragraph.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on .
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the nodes.
member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.
member.remarks: Calls , then calls for all child nodes of the paragraph and calls at the end.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Paragraph.GetText
member.summary: Gets the text of this paragraph including the end of paragraph character.

remarks.p: The text of all child nodes is concatenated and the end of paragraph character is appended as follows:

list.item: If the paragraph is the last paragraph of , then (\x000c) is appended.
If the paragraph is the last paragraph of , then (\x0007) is appended.
For all other paragraphs (\r) is appended.

remarks.p: The returned string includes all control and special characters as described in .

member.summary:
Gets or sets the value (in points) for a first line or hanging indent.
Use positive values to set the first-line indent, and negative values to set the hanging indent.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.ParagraphFormat.CharacterUnitFirstLineIndent
member.summary:
Gets or sets the value (in characters) for the first-line or hanging indent.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.ParagraphFormat.SpaceBeforeAuto
member.summary: True if the amount of spacing before the paragraph is set automatically.

remarks.p: When set to true, overrides the effect of .
When you set paragraph Space Before and Space After to Auto, Microsoft Word adds 14 points spacing between paragraphs automatically according to the following rules:

list.item: Normally, spacing is added after all paragraphs.
In a bulleted or numbered list, spacing is added only after the last item in the list. Spacing is not added between the list items.
In a nested bulleted or numbered list spacing is not added.
Spacing is normally added after a table.
Spacing is not added after a table if it is the last block in a table cell.
Spacing is not added after the last paragraph in a table cell.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.ParagraphFormat.SpaceAfterAuto
member.summary: True if the amount of spacing after the paragraph is set automatically.

remarks.p: When set to true, overrides the effect of .
When you set paragraph Space Before and Space After to Auto, Microsoft Word adds 14 points spacing between paragraphs automatically according to the following rules:

list.item: Normally, spacing is added after all paragraphs.
In a bulleted or numbered list, spacing is added only after the last item in the list. Spacing is not added between the list items.
In a nested bulleted or numbered list spacing is not added.
Spacing is normally added after a table.
Spacing is not added after a table if it is the last block in a table cell.
Spacing is not added after the last paragraph in a table cell.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.ParagraphFormat.SpaceBefore
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of spacing (in points) before the paragraph.

remarks.p: Has no effect when is true.
Valid values range from 0 to 1584 inclusive.

member.exception: Throws when argument was out of the range of valid values.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.ParagraphFormat.LineUnitBefore
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of spacing (in gridlines) before the paragraphs.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.ParagraphFormat.SpaceAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of spacing (in points) after the paragraph.

remarks.p: Has no effect when is true.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Range
member.summary:
Represents a contiguous area in a document.
To learn more, visit the Working with Ranges documentation article.

remarks.p: The document is represented by a tree of nodes and the nodes provide operations to work with the tree, but some operations are easier to perform if the document is treated as a contiguous sequence of text.
is a "facade" interface that provide methods that treat the document or portions of the document as "flat" text regardless of the fact that the document nodes are stored in a tree-like object model.
does not contain any text or nodes, it is merely a view or "window" over a fragment of a document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Range.Replace(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces all occurrences of a specified character string pattern with a replacement string.
member.remarks:
The pattern will not be used as regular expression. Please use if you need regular expressions.
Used case-insensitive comparison.
Method is able to process breaks in both pattern and replacement strings. You should use special meta-characters if you need to work with breaks:
&p - paragraph break
&b - section break
&m - page break
&l - manual line break Use method to have more flexible customization.

A string to replace all occurrences of pattern.
member.returns: The number of replacements made.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Range.UpdateFields
member.summary: Updates the values of document fields in this range.

remarks.para: When you open, modify and then save a document, Aspose.Words does not update fields automatically, it keeps them intact. Therefore, you would usually want to call this method before saving if you have modified the document programmatically and want to make sure the proper (calculated) field values appear in the saved document.
There is no need to update fields after executing a mail merge because mail merge is a kind of field update and automatically updates all fields in the document.
remarks.p: This method does not update all field types. For the detailed list of supported field types, see the Programmers Guide.
remarks.para: This method does not update fields that are related to the page layout algorithms (e.g. PAGE, PAGES, PAGEREF). The page layout-related fields are updated when you render a document or call .
To update fields in the whole document use .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Range.UnlinkFields
member.summary: Unlinks fields in this range.

remarks.para: Replaces all the fields in this range with their most recent results.
To unlink fields in the whole document use .

member.summary: Changes field type values of , , in this range so that they correspond to the field types contained in the field codes.

remarks.para: Use this method after document changes that affect field types.
To change field type values in the whole document use .

member.summary:
Represents a single custom tab stop. The object is a member of the collection.

remarks.p: Normally, a tab stop specifies a position where a tab stop exists. But because tab stops can be inherited from parent styles, it might be needed for the child object to define explicitly that there is no tab stop at a given position. To clear an inherited tab stop at a given position, create a object and set to .

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.TabStopCollection
member.summary:
A collection of objects that represent custom tabs for a paragraph or a style.
To learn more, visit the Aspose.Words Document Object Model (DOM) documentation article.

remarks.p: In Microsoft Word documents, a tab stop can be defined in the properties of a paragraph style or directly in the properties of a paragraph. A style can be based on another style. Therefore, the complete set of tab stops for a given object is a combination of tab stops defined directly on this object and tab stops inherited from the parent styles.

In Aspose.Words, when you obtain a for a paragraph or a style, it contains only the custom tab stops defined directly for this paragraph or style. The collection does not include tab stops defined in the parent styles or default tab stops.

member.dev: This whole collection is stored in the paragraph attributes as a single attribute.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.ComHelper
member.summary: Provides methods for COM clients to load a document into Aspose.Words.

remarks.p: Use the class to load a document from a file or stream into a object in a COM application.

The class provides a default constructor to create a new document and also provides overloaded constructors to load a document from a file or stream. If you are using Aspose.Words from a .NET application, you can use all of the constructors directly, but if you are using Aspose.Words from a COM application, only the default constructor is available.

example.code:
[VBScript]
Dim helper Set helper = CreateObject("Aspose.Words.ComHelper")
Dim doc Set doc = helper.Open(fileName)

remarks.p: This method is same as calling the constructor with a file name parameter.

Dim helper Set helper = CreateObject("Aspose.Words.ComHelper")
Dim doc Set doc = helper.Open(fileName)

member.returns: A object that represents a Word document.

summary.p: The Aspose.Words namespace provides classes for generating, converting, modifying, rendering and printing Microsoft Word documents without utilizing Microsoft Word.
Aspose.Words is written completely in C#, CLS compliant and contains only safe managed code. Microsoft Word is not required in order to use Aspose.Words.

The classes in the Aspose.Words namespace borrow best practices from two well-known frameworks: Microsoft Word Automation and System.Xml. A document in Aspose.Words is represented by a tree of nodes, much like in XML DOM. Where possible, class, method and property names match those found in Microsoft Word Automation.
The main classes in this namespace are:

list.item: is the main class of the object model that represents a Microsoft Word document.
provides an easy way to insert content and formatting into a document.
is the base class for all nodes in the document.
is the base class for all nodes of the document that can contain other nodes, for example , and and .

remarks.para: Provides access to objects by their names (using an indexer) and via a set of typed properties that return values of appropriate types.

remarks.p: The names of the properties are case-insensitive.
The properties in the collection are sorted alphabetically by name.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Properties.BuiltInDocumentProperties.Item(System.String)
member.overloads: Returns a object.
member.summary: Returns a object by the name of the property.

remarks.para: The string names of the properties correspond to the names of the typed properties available from .

If you request a property that is not present in the document, but the name of the property is recognized as a valid built-in name, a new is created, added to the collection and returned. The newly created property is assigned a default value (empty string, zero, false or DateTime.MinValue depending on the type of the built-in property).
If you request a property that is not present in the document and the name is not recognized as a built-in name, a null is returned.

member.param: The case-insensitive name of the property to retrieve.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.BuildingBlocks.BuildingBlock
member.summary:
Represents a glossary document entry such as a Building Block, AutoText or an AutoCorrect entry.
To learn more, visit the Aspose.Words Document Object Model (DOM) documentation article.

remarks.p: can contain only nodes.
can only be a child of .
remarks.para: You can create new building blocks and insert them into a glossary document. You can modify or delete existing building blocks. You can copy or move building blocks between documents. You can insert content of a building block into a document.
Corresponds to the docPart, docPartPr and docPartBody elements in OOXML.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the nodes.

remarks.para: Calls , then calls for all child nodes of this building block, then calls .
Note: A building block node and its children are not visited when you execute a Visitor over a . If you want to execute a Visitor over a building block, you need to execute the visitor over or call .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.BuildingBlocks.BuildingBlockCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a building block at the given index.

remarks.p: The index is zero-based.
Negative indexes are allowed and indicate access from the back of the collection. For example -1 means the last item, -2 means the second before last and so on.
If index is greater than or equal to the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.
If index is negative and its absolute value is greater than the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.

member.param: An index into the list of building blocks.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.BuildingBlocks.GlossaryDocument
member.summary:
Represents the root element for a glossary document within a Word document. A glossary document is a storage for AutoText, AutoCorrect entries and Building Blocks.
To learn more, visit the Aspose.Words Document Object Model (DOM) documentation article.

remarks.para: Some documents, usually templates, can contain AutoText, AutoCorrect entries and/or Building Blocks (also known as glossary document entries, document parts or building blocks).
To access building blocks, you need to load a document into a object. Building blocks will be available via the property.
can contain any number of objects. Each represents one document part.
Corresponds to the glossaryDocument and docParts elements in OOXML.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.BuildingBlocks.GlossaryDocument.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on .
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the nodes.
member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.

remarks.para: Calls , then calls for all child nodes of this node and then calls at the end.
Note: A glossary document node and its children are not visited when you execute a Visitor over a . If you want to execute a Visitor over a glossary document, you need to call .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.BuildingBlocks.GlossaryDocument.GetBuildingBlock(Aspose.Words.BuildingBlocks.BuildingBlockGallery,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Finds a building block using the specified gallery, category and name.

remarks.para: This is a convenience method that iterates over all building blocks in this collection and returns the first building block that matches the specified gallery, category and name.

Microsoft Word organizes building blocks into galleries. The galleries are predefined using the enum. Within each gallery, building blocks can be organized into one or more categories. The category name is a string. Each building block has a name. A building block name is not guaranteed to be unique.

member.param: The gallery criteria.
The category criteria. Can be null, in which case it will not be used for comparison.
The building block name criteria.
member.returns: The matching building block or null if a match was not found.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.BuildingBlocks.GlossaryDocument.LastBuildingBlock
member.summary: Gets the last building block in the glossary document.
member.remarks: Returns null if there are no building blocks available.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Settings.HyphenationOptions
member.summary:
Allows to configure document hyphenation options.
To learn more, visit the Working with Hyphenation documentation article.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.HyphenationOptions.AutoHyphenation
member.summary: Gets or sets value determining whether automatic hyphenation is turned on for the document. Default value for this property is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.HyphenationOptions.ConsecutiveHyphenLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of consecutive lines that can end with hyphens. Default value for this property is 0.

remarks.p: If value of this property is set to 0, any number of consecutive lines can end with hyphens.
The property does not have effect when saving to fixed page formats e.g. PDF.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.HyphenationOptions.HyphenationZone
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance in 1/20 of a point from the right margin within which you do not want to hyphenate words. Default value for this property is 360 (0.25 inch).
member.dev: MS Word does not hyphenate words starting inside the hyphenation zone. A smaller zone reduces the raggedness of the right margin, but more words may require hyphens. A larger zone increases the raggedness of the right margin, but fewer words may require hyphens.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.HyphenationOptions.HyphenateCaps
member.summary: Gets or sets value determining whether words written in all capital letters are hyphenated. Default value for this property is true.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Settings.Compatibility
member.summary: Specifies names of compatibility options.

member.summary: Allows Aspose.Wods to mimic MS Word version-specific application behavior.

member.summary: Optimize Aspose.Words behavior to match MS Word 2000 version.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Settings.MsWordVersion.Word2002
member.summary: Optimize Aspose.Words behavior to match MS Word 2002 version.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Settings.MsWordVersion.Word2003

summary.p: The Aspose.Words.Settings namespace contains classes and enums that are used when specifying various settings and options stored in a document. These are mail merge, write protection, compatibility and other settings.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Settings.OdsoDataSourceType
member.summary: Specifies the type of the external data source to be connected to as part of the ODSO connection information.

remarks.para: The OOXML specification is very vague for this enum. I guess it might correspond to the WdMergeSubType enumeration http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb237801.aspx.

member.dev: Do not renumber these.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Settings.OdsoFieldMapData
member.summary:
Specifies how a column in the external data source shall be mapped to the predefined merge fields within the document.
To learn more, visit the Mail Merge and Reporting documentation article.

remarks.para: Microsoft Word provides some predefined merge field names that it allows to insert into a document as MERGEFIELD or use in the ADDRESSBLOCK or GREETINGLINE fields. The information specified in allows to map one column in the external data source to a single predefined merge field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.OdsoFieldMapData.MappedName
member.summary: Specifies the predefined merge field name which shall be mapped to the column number specified by the property within this field mapping. The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.OdsoFieldMapData.Name

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.OdsoFieldMapData.Type
member.summary: Specifies if a given mail merge field has been mapped to a column in the given external data source or not. The default value is .

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Settings.Odso
member.summary:
Specifies the Office Data Source Object (ODSO) settings for a mail merge data source.
To learn more, visit the Mail Merge and Reporting documentation article.

remarks.para: ODSO seems to be the "new" way the newer Microsoft Word versions prefer to use when specifying certain types of data sources for a mail merge document. ODSO probably first appeared in Microsoft Word 2000.

The use of ODSO is poorly documented and the best way to learn how to use the properties of this object is to create a document with a desired data source manually in Microsoft Word and then open that document using Aspose.Words and examine the properties of the and objects. This is a good approach to take if you want to learn how to programmatically configure a data source, for example.
You do not normally need to create objects of this class directly because ODSO settings are always available via the property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Settings.Odso.Clone
member.summary: Returns a deep clone of this object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.Odso.ColumnDelimiter
member.summary: Specifies the character which shall be interpreted as the column delimiter used to separate columns within external data sources. The default value is 0 which means there is no column delimiter defined.

remarks.para: RK I have never seen this in use.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.Odso.FirstRowContainsColumnNames
member.summary: Specifies that a hosting application shall treat the first row of data in the specified external data source as a header row containing the names of each column in the data source. The default value is false.

remarks.para: RK I have never seen this in use.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.Odso.DataSource
member.summary: Specifies the location of the external data source to be connected to a document to perform the mail merge. The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.Odso.TableName
member.summary: Specifies the particular set of data that a source shall be connected to within an external data source. The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.Odso.DataSourceType
member.summary: Specifies the type of the external data source to be connected to as part of the ODSO connection information for this mail merge. The default value is .

remarks.para: This setting is purely a suggestion of the data source type that is being used for this mail merge.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.Odso.UdlConnectString
member.summary: Specifies the Universal Data Link (UDL) connection string used to connect to an external data source. The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.Odso.FieldMapDatas
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of objects that specify how columns from the external data source are mapped to the predefined merge field names in the document. This object is never null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.Odso.RecipientDatas
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of objects that specify inclusion/exclusion of individual records in the mail merge. This object is never null.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Settings.OdsoRecipientData
member.summary:
Represents information about a single record within an external data source that is to be excluded from the mail merge.
To learn more, visit the Mail Merge and Reporting documentation article.

remarks.para: If a record shall be merged into a merged document, then no information is needed about that record. However, if a given record shall not be merged into a merged document, then the value of the unique key for that record shall be stored in the property of this object to indicate this exclusion.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Settings.OdsoRecipientData.Clone
member.summary: Returns a deep clone of this object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.OdsoRecipientData.Active
member.summary: Specifies whether the record from the data source shall be imported into a document when the mail merge is performed. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.OdsoRecipientData.Column
member.summary: Specifies the column within the data source that contains unique data for the current record. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.OdsoRecipientData.UniqueTag
member.summary: Specifies the contents of a given record in the column containing unique data. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.OdsoRecipientData.Hash
member.summary: Represents the hash code for this record. Sometimes Microsoft Word uses of a whole record instead of a value. The default value is 0.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Settings.CompatibilityOptions
member.summary:
Contains compatibility options (that is, the user preferences entered on the Compatibility tab of the Options dialog in Microsoft Word).
To learn more, visit the Detect File Format and Check Format Compatibility documentation article.

summary.para: Allows to optimize the document contents as well as default Aspose.Words behavior to a particular versions of MS Word.
Use this method to prevent MS Word from displaying "Compatibility mode" ribbon upon document loading. (Note that you may also need to set the property to or higher.)

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.CompatibilityOptions.UICompat97To2003
member.summary: True to disable UI functionality which is not compatible with Word97-2003. Default value is false.
member.remarks:
Controls the Word97-2003 compatibility setting that disables UI functionality which is not compatible with Word97-2003. When true, 'w:uiCompat97To2003' XML element is written to '\word\settings.xml' document package part. Default value is false. When set to false, this element is not written.
Technically this property is not part of compatibility options, but we have put it here for API convenience.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Settings.JustificationMode
member.summary: Specifies the character spacing adjustment for a document. The default value is Expand.
member.dev: In HTML, this is equivalent to setting text-justify-trim on the BODY element.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings
member.summary:
Specifies all of the mail merge information for a document.
To learn more, visit the Mail Merge and Reporting documentation article.

remarks.para: You can use this object to specify a mail merge data source for a document and this information (along with the available data fields) will appear in Microsoft Word when the user opens this document. Or you can use this object to query mail merge settings that the user has specified in Microsoft Word for this document.
You do not normally need to create objects of this class directly because Mail merge settings of a document are always available via the property.
To detect whether this document is a mail merge main document, check the value of the property.

To remove mail merge settings and data source information from a document you can use the method. Aspose.Words will not write mail merge settings to a document if the property is set to or the property is set to .

The best way to learn how to use the properties of this object is to create a document with a desired data source manually in Microsoft Word and then open that document using Aspose.Words and examine the properties of the and objects. This is a good approach to take if you want to learn how to programmatically configure a data source, for example.

Aspose.Words preserves mail merge information when loading, saving and converting documents between different formats, but does not use this information when performing its own mail merge using the object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.Clear
member.summary: Clears the mail merge settings in such a way that when the document is saved, no mail merge settings will be saved and it will become a normal document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.Clone
member.summary: Returns a deep clone of this object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.ActiveRecord
member.summary: Specifies the one-based index of the record from the data source which shall be displayed in Microsoft Word. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.AddressFieldName
member.summary: Specifies the column within the data source that contains e-mail addresses. The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.CheckErrors
member.summary: Specifies the type of error reporting which shall be conducted by Microsoft Word when performing a mail merge. The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.ConnectString
member.summary: Specifies the connection string used to connect to an external data source. The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.DataSource
member.summary: Specifies the path to the mail-merge data source. The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.DataType
member.summary: Specifies the type of the mail-merge data source and the method of data access. The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.Destination
member.summary: Specifies how Microsoft Word will output the results of a mail merge. The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.DoNotSupressBlankLines
member.summary: Specifies how an application performing the mail merge shall handle blank lines in the merged documents resulting from the mail merge. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.HeaderSource
member.summary: Specifies the path to the mail-merge header source. The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.LinkToQuery
member.summary: Not sure about this one. The Microsoft Word Automation Reference suggests that this specifies that the query is executed every time the document is opened in Microsoft Word. But the OOXML specification suggests that this specifies that the query contains a reference to an external query file which contains the actual query. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.MailAsAttachment
member.summary: Specifies that the documents produced during a mail merge operation should be emailed as an attachment rather than the body of the actual e-mail. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.MailSubject
member.summary: Specifies the text which shall appear in the subject line of the e-mails or faxes produced during mail merge. The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.MainDocumentType
member.summary: Specifies the mail-merge main document type. The default value is .

remarks.para: The main document is the document that contains information that is the same for each version of the merged document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.Odso
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that specifies the Office Data Source Object (ODSO) settings.

remarks.para: This object is never null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.Query
member.summary: Contains the Structured Query Language string that shall be run against the specified external data source to return the set of records which shall be imported into the document when the mail merge operation is performed. The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.MailMergeSettings.ViewMergedData
member.summary: Specifies that Microsoft Word shall display the data from the specified external data source where merge fields have been inserted (e.g. preview merged data). The default value is false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Settings.WriteProtection
member.summary:
Specifies write protection settings for a document.
To learn more, visit the Protect or Encrypt a Document documentation article.

remarks.para: Write protection specifies whether the author has recommended that the document is to be opened as read-only and/or require a password to modify a document.
Write protection is different from document protection. Write protection is specified in Microsoft Word in the options of the Save As dialog box.
You do not create instances of this class directly. You access document protection settings via the property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Settings.WriteProtection.SetPassword(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the write protection password for the document.

remarks.para: If a password is set, Microsoft Word will require the user to enter it or open the document as read-only.

member.param: The password to set. Cannot be null, but can be an empty string.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Settings.WriteProtection.ValidatePassword(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified password is the same as the write-protection password the document was protected with. If document is not write-protected with password then returns false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.WriteProtection.ReadOnlyRecommended
member.summary: Specifies whether the document author has recommended that the document be opened as read-only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.WriteProtection.IsWriteProtected
member.summary: Returns true when a write protection password is set.

To learn more, visit the Work with Options and Appearance of Word Documents documentation article.

member.summary: Controls the view mode in Microsoft Word.

remarks.p: Although Aspose.Words is able to read and write this option, its usage is application-specific. For example MS Word 2013 does not respect the value of this option.

member.summary: Gets or sets a zoom value based on the size of the window.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Settings.ViewOptions.ZoomPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage (between 10 and 500) at which you want to view your document.

remarks.p: If value is 0 then this property uses 100 instead, else if value is less than 10 or greater than 500 this property throws.
Although Aspose.Words is able to read and write this option, its usage is application-specific. For example MS Word 2013 does not respect the value of this option.

summary.p: The Aspose.Words.Math namespace contains classes that represent Office Math elements.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Math.OfficeMath
member.summary:
Represents an Office Math object such as function, equation, matrix or alike. Can contain child elements including runs of mathematical text, bookmarks, comments, other instances and some other nodes.
To learn more, visit the Working with OfficeMath documentation article.

remarks.para: In this version of Aspose.Words, nodes do not provide public methods and properties to create or modify a object. In this version you are not able to instantiate nodes or modify existing except deleting them.
remarks.p: can only be a child of .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Math.OfficeMath.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on .
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the nodes.
member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.
member.remarks: Calls , then calls for all child nodes of the Office Math and calls at the end.

member.summary: Creates and returns an object that can be used to render this equation into an image.

remarks.para: This method just invokes the constructor and passes this object as a parameter.

member.returns: The renderer object for this equation.

member.summary: Gets/sets Office Math justification.

remarks.para: Justification cannot be set to the Office Math with display format type .
Inline justification cannot be set to the Office Math with display format type .
Corresponding has to be set before setting Office Math justification.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Math.OfficeMath.DisplayType
member.summary: Gets/sets Office Math display format type which represents whether an equation is displayed inline with the text or displayed on its own line.

remarks.para: Display format type has effect for top level Office Math only.
Returned display format type is always for nested Office Math.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Reporting.CsvDataSource
member.summary:
Provides access to data of a CSV file or stream to be used within a report.
To learn more, visit the LINQ Reporting Engine documentation article.

remarks.para: To access data of the corresponding file or stream while generating a report, pass an instance of this class as a data source to one of .BuildReport overloads.

In template documents, a instance should be treated in the same way as if it was a instance. For more information, see template syntax reference (https://docs.aspose.com/display/wordsnet/Template+Syntax).

Data types of comma-separated values are determined automatically upon their string representations. So in template documents, you can work with typed values rather than just strings. The engine is capable to automatically recognize values of the following types:
Note that for automatic recognition of data types to work, string representations of comma-separated values should be formed using invariant culture settings.
To override default behavior of CSV data loading, initialize and pass a instance to a constructor of this class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class with default options.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Reporting.JsonDataLoadOptions.SimpleValueParseMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a mode for parsing JSON simple values (null, boolean, number, integer, and string) while loading JSON. Such a mode does not affect parsing of date-time values. The default is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Reporting.JsonDataLoadOptions.ExactDateTimeParseFormats
member.summary: Gets or sets exact formats for parsing JSON date-time values while loading JSON. The default is null.

remarks.para: Strings encoded using Microsoft® JSON date-time format (for example, "/Date(1224043200000)/") are always recognized as date-time values regardless of a value of this property. The property defines additional formats to be used while parsing date-time values from strings in the following way:

list.item: When is null, the ISO-8601 format and all date-time formats supported for the current, English USA, and English New Zealand cultures are used additionally in the mentioned order.
When contains strings, they are used as additional date-time formats utilizing the current culture.
When is empty, no additional date-time formats are used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Reporting.JsonDataLoadOptions.AlwaysGenerateRootObject
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether a generated data source will always contain an object for a JSON root element. If a JSON root element contains a single complex property, such an object is not created by default.
member.remarks: The default value is false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Reporting.JsonDataSource
member.summary:
Provides access to data of a JSON file or stream to be used within a report.
To learn more, visit the LINQ Reporting Engine documentation article.

remarks.para: To access data of the corresponding file or stream while generating a report, pass an instance of this class as a data source to one of .BuildReport overloads.

In template documents, if a top-level JSON element is an array, a instance should be treated in the same way as if it was a instance. If a top-level JSON element is an object, a instance should be treated in the same way as if it was a instance. For more information, see template syntax reference (https://docs.aspose.com/display/wordsnet/Template+Syntax).
In template documents, you can work with typed values of JSON elements. For convenience, the engine replaces the set of JSON simple types with the following one:
The engine automatically recognizes values of the extra types upon their JSON representations.
To override default behavior of JSON data loading, initialize and pass a instance to a constructor of this class.

member.summary: Specifies the mode where types of JSON simple values are determined upon parsing of their string representations. For example, the type of 'prop' from the JSON snippet '{ prop: "123" }' is determined as integer in this mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Reporting.JsonSimpleValueParseMode.Strict
member.summary: Specifies the mode where types of JSON simple values are determined from JSON notation itself. For example, the type of 'prop' from the JSON snippet '{ prop: "123" }' is determined as string in this mode.

member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether a generated data source will always contain an object for an XML root element. If an XML root element has no attributes and all its child elements have same names, such an object is not created by default.
member.remarks: The default value is false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Reporting.XmlDataSource
member.summary:
Provides access to data of an XML file or stream to be used within a report.
To learn more, visit the LINQ Reporting Engine documentation article.

remarks.para: To access data of the corresponding file or stream while generating a report, pass an instance of this class as a data source to one of .BuildReport overloads.

In template documents, if a top-level XML element contains only a list of elements of the same type, an instance should be treated in the same way as if it was a instance. Otherwise, an instance should be treated in the same way as if it was a instance. For more information, see template syntax reference (https://docs.aspose.com/display/wordsnet/Template+Syntax).

When XML Schema Definition is passed to a constructor of this class, data types of values of simple XML elements and attributes are determined according to the schema. So in template documents, you can work with typed values rather than just strings.

When XML Schema Definition is not passed to a constructor of this class, data types of values of simple XML elements and attributes are determined automatically upon their string representations. So in template documents, you can work with typed values in this case as well. The engine is capable to automatically recognize values of the following types:
Note that for automatic recognition of data types to work, string representations of values of simple XML elements and attributes should be formed using invariant culture settings.
To override default behavior of XML data loading, initialize and pass a instance to a constructor of this class.

summary.p: This namespace contains classes of the Aspose.Words' new reporting engine that supports report templates marked up with a language based on the LINQ Method Syntax.

This new reporting engine is more advanced than the original mail merge reporting engine and allows to retrieve data from any .NET class, perform grouping, sorting, joining and interpret C# expressions.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportBuildOptions
member.summary: Specifies options controlling behavior of while building a report.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportBuildOptions.None
member.summary: Specifies default options.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportBuildOptions.AllowMissingMembers
member.summary: Specifies that missing object members should be treated as null literals by the engine. This option affects only access to instance (that is, non-static) object members and extension methods. If this option is not set, the engine throws an exception when encounters a missing object member.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportBuildOptions.RemoveEmptyParagraphs
member.summary: Specifies that the engine should remove paragraphs becoming empty after template syntax tags are removed or replaced with empty values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportBuildOptions.InlineErrorMessages
member.summary: Specifies that the engine should inline template syntax error messages into output documents. If this option is not set, the engine throws an exception when encounters a syntax error.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportBuildOptions.UseLegacyHeaderFooterVisiting
member.summary: Specifies that the engine should visit section child nodes (headers, footers, bodies) in an order compatible with Aspose.Words versions prior 21.9.

remarks.para: By default, the engine treats headers and footers as if they were linked to section breaks. That is, when visiting section child nodes, a body is visited first and only then, headers and footers are visited. This agrees with Microsoft Word behavior when copy-pasting or removing multi-section contents and produces more correct results in most scenarios.

Prior to Aspose.Words 21.9, the engine used another visiting order: Section child nodes were visited in an order they appear in a document. Apply this value to if compatibility with older versions of Aspose.Words is required.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportBuildOptions.RespectJpegExifOrientation
member.summary: Specifies that the engine should use EXIF ​​image orientation values to appropriately rotate inserted JPEG images.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportingEngine
member.summary:
Provides routines to populate template documents with data and a set of settings to control these routines.
To learn more, visit the LINQ Reporting Engine documentation article.
member.dev: This class is just a facade of . Descriptional comments of these classes should be kept in sync.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportingEngine.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportingEngine.BuildReport(Aspose.Words.Document,System.Object)
member.summary: Populates the specified template document with data from the specified source making it a ready report.

remarks.para: Using this overload you can reference the data source's members in the template document, but you cannot reference the data source object itself. You should use the overload to achieve this.
A data source object can be of one of the following types:

list.item: Any other arbitrary non-dynamic and non-anonymous .NET type

remarks.para: For information on how to work with data sources of different types in template documents, see template syntax reference (https://docs.aspose.com/display/wordsnet/Template+Syntax).

member.param: A template document to be populated with data.
A data source object.
member.returns: A flag indicating whether parsing of the template document was successful. The returned flag makes sense only if a value of the property includes the option.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportingEngine.BuildReport(Aspose.Words.Document,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Populates the specified template document with data from the specified source making it a ready report.

remarks.para: Using this overload you can reference the data source's members and the data source object itself in the template. If you are not going to reference the data source object itself, you can omit passing null or use the overload.
A data source object can be of one of the following types:

list.item: Any other arbitrary non-dynamic and non-anonymous .NET type

remarks.para: For information on how to work with data sources of different types in template documents, see template syntax reference (https://docs.aspose.com/display/wordsnet/Template+Syntax).

member.param: A template document to be populated with data.
A data source object.
A name to reference the data source object in the template.
member.returns: A flag indicating whether parsing of the template document was successful. The returned flag makes sense only if a value of the property includes the option.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportingEngine.BuildReport(Aspose.Words.Document,System.Object[],System.String[])
member.summary: Populates the specified template document with data from the specified sources making it a ready report.

remarks.para: Using this overload you can reference multiple data source objects and their members in the template. The name of the first data source can be omitted (i.e. be an empty string or null) if you are going to reference the data source's members but not the data source object itself. Names of the other data sources must be specified and unique.
If you are going to use a single data source, consider using of and overloads instead.
A data source object can be of one of the following types:

list.item: Any other arbitrary non-dynamic and non-anonymous .NET type

remarks.para: For information on how to work with data sources of different types in template documents, see template syntax reference (https://docs.aspose.com/display/wordsnet/Template+Syntax).

member.param: A template document to be populated with data.
An array of data source objects.
An array of names to reference the data source objects within the template.
member.returns: A flag indicating whether parsing of the template document was successful. The returned flag makes sense only if a value of the property includes the option.

member.summary: Serves as a hash function for this type.

member.summary: Gets or sets a set of flags controlling behavior of this instance while building a report.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportingEngine.KnownTypes
member.summary: Gets an unordered set (i.e. a collection of unique items) containing objects which fully or partially qualified names can be used within report templates processed by this engine instance to invoke the corresponding types' static members, perform type casts, etc.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Reporting.ReportingEngine.UseReflectionOptimization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether invocations of custom type members performed via reflection API are optimized using dynamic class generation or not. The default value is true.
member.remarks:
There are some scenarios where it is preferrable to disable this optimization. For example, if you are dealing with small collections of data items all the time, then an overhead of dynamic class generation can be more noticeable than an overhead of direct reflection API calls.
The option does not have effect when run on iOS and reflection optimization is not used.
member.dev: Normally, such settings should be located in configuration files, but it seems like there is no autoportable way to achieve this.

Represents an unordered set (i.e. a collection of unique items) containing objects which fully or partially qualified names can be used within report templates to invoke the corresponding types' static members, perform type casts, etc.
To learn more, visit the LINQ Reporting Engine documentation article.

- represents a generic type.
- represents an array type.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Rendering.AsposeWordsPrintDocument
member.summary:
Provides a default implementation for printing of a within the .NET printing framework.
To learn more, visit the Printing a Document Programmatically or Using Dialogs documentation article.

remarks.para: overrides to print the range of pages that is specified in .

A single Word document can consist of multiple sections that specify pages with different sizes, orientation and paper trays. overrides to properly select paper size, orientation and paper source when printing a Word document.

Microsoft Word stores printer specific values for paper trays in a Word document and therefore, only printing on the same printer model as the one that was selected when the user specified the paper trays will result in printing from the correct trays. If you print a document on a different printer, then most likely the default paper tray will be used, not the trays specified in the document.

member.dev:
At the moment this is just a crude hack to preserve themes during DOCX to DOCX roundtrip, but later should be worked into a more appropriate object.
WORDSNET-10513. Limited support for theme handling was implemented. If customer changes one of theme part then theme is rewritten with new values. If theme is unchanged during roundtrip then it is written raw as before.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Tables.AutoFitBehavior
member.summary: Determines how Aspose.Words resizes the table when you invoke the method.

summary.para: Aspose.Words enables the AutoFit option, removes the preferred width from the table and all cells and then updates the table layout.
In the resulting table, cell widths are updated to fit the table contents. Most likely, the table will shrink.
When you use this value, Aspose.Words enables the AutoFit option, sets the preferred width for the table to 100%, removes preferred widths from all cells and then updates the table layout.
As a result, the table occupies all available width and the cell widths are updated to fit table contents.
Aspose.Words disables the AutoFit option and removes the preferred with from the table.
The widths of the cells remain as they are specified by their properties.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Tables.CellFormat.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Returns or sets the vertical alignment of text in the cell.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Tables.CellFormat.Width
member.summary: Gets the width of the cell in points.

remarks.para: The width is calculated by Aspose.Words on document loading and saving. Currently, not every combination of table, cell and document properties is supported. The returned value may not be accurate for some documents. It may not exactly match the cell width as calculated by MS Word when the document is opened in MS Word.

Setting this property is not recommended. There is no guarantee that the cell will actually have the set width. The width may be adjusted to accommodate cell contents in an auto-fit table layout. Cells in other rows may have conflicting width settings. The table may be resized to fit into the container or to meet table width settings. Consider using for setting the cell width. Setting this property sets implicitly since version 15.8.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Tables.CellFormat.PreferredWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets the preferred width of the cell.

remarks.para: The preferred width (along with the table's Auto Fit option) determines how the actual width of the cell is calculated by the table layout algorithm. Table layout can be performed by Aspose.Words when it saves the document or by Microsoft Word when it displays the document.
The preferred width can be specified in points or in percent. The preferred width can also be specified as "auto", which means no preferred width is specified.
The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Tables.CellFormat.VerticalMerge
member.summary: Specifies how the cell is merged with other cells vertically.

remarks.p: Cells can only be merged vertically if their left and right boundaries are identical.

When cells are vertically merged, the display areas of the merged cells are consolidated. The consolidated area is used to display the contents of the first vertically merged cell and all other vertically merged cells must be empty.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Tables.CellFormat.HorizontalMerge
member.summary: Specifies how the cell is merged horizontally with other cells in the row.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Tables.CellFormat.Orientation
member.summary: Returns or sets the orientation of text in a table cell.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Tables.CellFormat.FitText
member.summary: If true, fits text in the cell, compressing each paragraph to the width of the cell.

member.summary: If true, wrap text for the cell.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Tables.Table.AutoFit(Aspose.Words.Tables.AutoFitBehavior)
member.summary: Resizes the table and cells according to the specified auto fit behavior.

remarks.para: This method mimics the commands available in the Auto Fit menu for a table in Microsoft Word. The commands available are "Auto Fit to Contents", "Auto Fit to Window" and "Fixed Column Width". In Microsoft Word these commands set relevant table properties and then update the table layout and Aspose.Words does the same for you.

member.param: Specifies how to auto fit the table.
