summary.para: Specifies a unique read-only persistent numerical Id for this structured document tag.

remarks.para:
Id attribute shall follow these rules:
The document shall retain structured document tag ids only if the whole document is cloned .
During Id shall be retained if import does not cause conflicts with other structured document tag Ids in the target document.
If multiple structured document tag nodes specify the same decimal number value for the Id attribute, then the first structured document tag in the document shall maintain this original Id, and all subsequent structured document tag nodes shall have new identifiers assigned to them when the document is loaded.
During standalone structured document tag operation new unique ID will be generated for the cloned structured document tag node.
If Id is not specified in the source document, then the structured document tag node shall have a new unique identifier assigned to it when the document is loaded.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.StructuredDocumentTagRangeStart.LockContentControl
member.summary: When set to true, this property will prohibit a user from deleting this structured document tag.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.StructuredDocumentTagRangeStart.LockContents
member.summary: When set to true, this property will prohibit a user from editing the contents of this structured document tag.

summary.para: Specifies whether the content of this structured document tag shall be interpreted to contain placeholder text (as opposed to regular text contents within the structured document tag).
if set to true, this state shall be resumed (showing placeholder text) upon opening this document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.StructuredDocumentTagRangeStart.Placeholder
member.summary: Gets the containing placeholder text which should be displayed when this structured document tag run contents are empty, the associated mapped XML element is empty as specified via the element or the element is true.
member.remarks: Can be null, meaning that the placeholder is not applicable for this structured document tag.

summary.para: Gets or sets Name of the containing placeholder text.
with this name has to be present in the otherwise will occur.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Markup.StructuredDocumentTag
member.summary:
Represents a structured document tag (SDT or content control) in a document.
To learn more, visit the Structured Document Tags or Content Control documentation article.

remarks.para: Structured document tags (SDTs) allow to embed customer-defined semantics as well as its behavior and appearance into a document.

In this version Aspose.Words provides a number of public methods and properties to manipulate the behavior and content of . Mapping of SDT nodes to custom XML packages within a document can be performed with using the property.
can occur in a document in the following places:

list.item: Block-level - Among paragraphs and tables, as a child of a , , , or a node.
Row-level - Among rows in a table, as a child of a node.
Cell-level - Among cells in a table row, as a child of a node.
Inline-level - Among inline content inside, as a child of a .
Nested inside another .

remarks.para: The following types of SDT can be created:

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.StructuredDocumentTag.SdtType
member.summary: Gets type of this Structured document tag.

summary.para: Specifies a unique read-only persistent numerical Id for this SDT.

remarks.para:
Id attribute shall follow these rules:
The document shall retain SDT ids only if the whole document is cloned .
During Id shall be retained if import does not cause conflicts with other SDT Ids in the target document.
If multiple SDT nodes specify the same decimal number value for the Id attribute, then the first SDT in the document shall maintain this original Id, and all subsequent SDT nodes shall have new identifiers assigned to them when the document is loaded.
During standalone SDT operation new unique ID will be generated for the cloned SDT node.
If Id is not specified in the source document, then the SDT node shall have a new unique identifier assigned to it when the document is loaded.

member.summary: When set to true, this property will prohibit a user from editing the contents of this SDT.

summary.para: Specifies whether the content of this SDT shall be interpreted to contain placeholder text (as opposed to regular text contents within the SDT).
if set to true, this state shall be resumed (showing placeholder text) upon opening this document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.StructuredDocumentTag.XmlMapping
member.summary: Gets an object that represents the mapping of this structured document tag to XML data in a custom XML part of the current document.
member.remarks: You can use the method of this object to map a structured document tag to XML data.
member.dev: If this element is present and the parent Sdt is not of a rich text type, then the current value of the Sdt shall be determined by finding the XML element (if any) which is determined by the attributes on this element. See Iso29500, chapter 1, 17.5.2.6 dataBinding (XML Mapping). If DataBinding information does not result in an XML element, then the application can use any algorithm desired to find the closest available match. If this information does result in an XML element, then the contents of that element shall be used to replace the current run content within the document.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType
member.summary: Specifies the possible types of calendars which can be used to specify in an Office Open XML document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Default
member.summary: Used as default value in OOXML. Equals .

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Gregorian
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. This calendar should be localized into the appropriate language.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.GregorianArabic
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be presented in Arabic.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.GregorianMeFrench
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be presented in Middle East French.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.GregorianUs
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be presented in English.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.GregorianXlitEnglish
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be the representation of the English strings in the corresponding Arabic characters (the Arabic transliteration of the English for the Gregorian calendar).

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.GregorianXlitFrench
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be the representation of the French strings in the corresponding Arabic characters (the Arabic transliteration of the French for the Gregorian calendar).

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Hebrew
member.summary: Specifies that the Hebrew lunar calendar, as described by the Gauss formula for Passover [CITATION] and The Complete Restatement of Oral Law (Mishneh Torah),shall be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Hijri
member.summary: Specifies that the Hijri lunar calendar, as described by the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, Ministry of Islamic Affairs, Endowments, Da‘wah and Guidance, shall be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Japan
member.summary: Specifies that the Japanese Emperor Era calendar, as described by Japanese Industrial Standard JIS X 0301, shall be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Korea
member.summary: Specifies that the Korean Tangun Era calendar, as described by Korean Law Enactment No. 4, shall be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.None
member.summary: Specifies that no calendar should be used.
member.remarks: Usually in AW, None is the first and default value for enums, but not in this case. None is not default for OOXML, instead is default and is first member of this enum.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Saka
member.summary: Specifies that the Saka Era calendar, as described by the Calendar Reform Committee of India, as part of the Indian Ephemeris and Nautical Almanac, shall be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Taiwan
member.summary: Specifies that the Taiwanese calendar, as defined by the Chinese National Standard CNS 7648, shall be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Markup.SdtCalendarType.Thai
member.summary: Specifies that the Thai calendar, as defined by the Royal Decree of H.M. King Vajiravudh (Rama VI) in Royal Gazette B. E. 2456 (1913 A.D.) and by the decree of Prime Minister Phibunsongkhram (1941 A.D.) to start the year on the Gregorian January 1 and to map year zero to Gregorian year 543 B.C., shall be used.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Markup.CustomPart
member.summary:
Represents a custom (arbitrary content) part, that is not defined by the ISO/IEC 29500 standard.
To learn more, visit the Structured Document Tags or Content Control documentation article.

remarks.para: This class represents an OOXML part that is a target of an "unknown relationship". All relationships not defined within ISO/IEC 29500 are considered "unknown relationships". Unknown relationships are permitted within an Office Open XML document provided that they conform to relationship markup guidelines.
Microsoft Word preserves custom parts during open/save cycles. Some additional info can be found here http://blogs.msdn.com/dmahugh/archive/2006/11/25/arbitrary-content-in-an-opc-package.aspx
Aspose.Words also roundtrips custom parts and in addition, allows to programmatically access such parts via the and objects.
Do not confuse custom parts with Custom XML Data. Use if you need to access Custom XML Data.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Markup.CustomPart.Clone
member.summary: Makes a "deep enough" copy of the object. Does not duplicate the bytes of the value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.CustomPart.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets this part's absolute name within the OOXML package or the target URL.

remarks.para: If the relationship target is internal, then this property is the absolute part name within the package. If the relationship target is external, then this property is the target URL.
The default value is an empty string. A valid value must be a non-empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.CustomPart.RelationshipType
member.summary: Gets or sets the relationship type from the parent part to this custom part.

remarks.para: The relationship type for a custom part must be "unknown" e.g. a custom relationship type, not one of the relationship types defined within ISO/IEC 29500.
The default value is an empty string. A valid value must be a non-empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.CustomPart.IsExternal

remarks.para: The default value is false.

remarks.para: This property is applicable only when is false.

remarks.para: This property is applicable only when is false.
The default value is an empty byte array. The value cannot be null.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Markup.CustomXmlPart
member.summary:
Represents a Custom XML Data Storage Part (custom XML data within a package).
To learn more, visit the Structured Document Tags or Content Control documentation article.

remarks.para: A DOCX or DOC document can contain one or more Custom XML Data Storage parts. Aspose.Words preserves and allows to create and extract Custom XML Data via the collection.

member.summary: Makes a "deep enough" copy of the object. Does not duplicate the bytes of the value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.CustomXmlPart.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that identifies this custom XML part within an OOXML document.

remarks.para: ISO/IEC 29500 specifies that this value is a GUID, but old versions of Microsoft Word allowed any string here. Aspose.Words does the same for ECMA-376 format. But note, that Microsoft Word Online fails to open a document created with a non-GUID value. So, a GUID is preferred value for this property.
A valid value must be an identifier that is unique among all custom XML data parts in this document.
The default value is an empty string. The value cannot be null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.CustomXmlPart.Schemas
member.summary: Specifies the set of XML schemas that are associated with this custom XML part.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.CustomXmlPart.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the XML content of this Custom XML Data Storage Part.

remarks.para: The default value is an empty byte array. The value cannot be null.

summary.p: The Aspose.Words.Markup namespace contains classes that represent customer defined semantics in a document: smart tags, custom XML and structured document tags (content controls).

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Markup.SmartTag
member.summary:
This element specifies the presence of a smart tag around one or more inline structures (runs, images, fields,etc.) within a paragraph.
To learn more, visit the Structured Document Tags or Content Control documentation article.

remarks.para: Smart tags is a kind of custom XML markup. Smart tags provide a facility for embedding customer-defined semantics into the document via the ability to provide a basic namespace/name for a run or set of runs within a document.
remarks.p: can be a child of a or another node.
The complete list of child nodes that can occur inside a smart tag consists of , , , , , , , , , , , , , , .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Markup.SmartTag.#ctor(Aspose.Words.DocumentBase)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: When you create a new node, you need to specify a document to which the node belongs. A node cannot exist without a document because it depends on the document-wide structures such as lists and styles. Although a node always belongs to a document, a node might or might not be a part of the document tree.
When a node is created, it belongs to a document, but is not yet part of the document tree and is null. To insert a node into the document, use the or methods on the parent node.

member.param: The owner document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Markup.SmartTag.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on .
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the nodes.
member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.
member.remarks: Calls , then calls for all child nodes of the smart tag and calls at the end.

member.summary: Returns .

member.summary: Specifies the name of the smart tag within the document.

remarks.para: Cannot be null.
Default is empty string.

member.summary: Specifies the namespace URI of the smart tag.

remarks.para: Cannot be null.
Default is empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Markup.SmartTag.Properties
member.summary: A collection of the smart tag properties.

remarks.para: Cannot be null.

is an inline-level node and can only be a child of .

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fonts.DefaultFontSubstitutionRule
member.summary:
Default font substitution rule.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fonts documentation article.
member.remarks: This rule defines single default font name to be used for substitution if the original font is not available.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fonts.DefaultFontSubstitutionRule.DefaultFontName
member.summary: Gets or sets the default font name.

remarks.para: The default value is 'Times New Roman'.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontNameSubstitutionRule
member.summary:
Font substitution rule for processing font name.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fonts documentation article.
member.remarks: According to this rule Aspose.Words tries to process the font name to get the substitution. Particularly Aspose.Words tries to removes suffixes with '-', ',' and '(' separators like it does the MS Word.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontConfigSubstitutionRule
member.summary:
Font config substitution rule.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fonts documentation article.

remarks.para: This rule uses fontconfig utility on Linux (and other Unix-like) platforms to get the substitution if the original font is not available.
If fontconfig utility is not available then this rule will be ignored.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontConfigSubstitutionRule.IsFontConfigAvailable
member.summary: Check if fontconfig utility is available or not.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontConfigSubstitutionRule.ResetCache
member.summary: Resets the cache of fontconfig calling results.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontConfigSubstitutionRule.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the rule is enabled or not.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontInfoSubstitutionRule
member.summary:
Font info substitution rule.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fonts documentation article.
member.remarks: According to this rule Aspose.Words evaluates all the related fields in (Panose, Sig etc) for the missing font and finds the closest match among the available font sources. If is not available for the missing font then nothing will be done.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSubstitutionRule
member.summary:
This is an abstract base class for the font substitution rule.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fonts documentation article.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSubstitutionRule.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the rule is enabled or not.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSubstitutionSettings
member.summary:
Specifies font substitution mechanism settings.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fonts documentation article.

remarks.para: Font substitution process consists of several rules which are checked one by one in specific order. If the first rule can't resolve the font then second rule is checked and so on.

The order of the rules is following: 1. Font name substitution rule (enabled by default) 2. Font config substitution rule (disabled by default) 3. Table substitution rule (enabled by default) 4. Font info substitution rule (enabled by default) 5. Default font rule (enabled by default)

Note that font info substitution rule will always resolve the font if is available and will override the default font rule. If you want to use the default font rule then you should disable the font info substitution rule.
Note that font config substitution rule will resolve the font in most cases and thus overrides all other rules.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSubstitutionSettings.TableSubstitution
member.summary: Settings related to table substitution rule.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSubstitutionSettings.FontInfoSubstitution
member.summary: Settings related to font info substitution rule.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSubstitutionSettings.DefaultFontSubstitution
member.summary: Settings related to default font substitution rule.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSubstitutionSettings.FontConfigSubstitution
member.summary: Settings related to font config substitution rule.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSubstitutionSettings.FontNameSubstitution
member.summary: Settings related to font name substitution rule.

Base class for user-defined stream font source.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fonts documentation article.

remarks.para: In order to use the stream font source you should create a derived class from the and provide implementation of the method.

method could be called several times. For the first time it will be called when Aspose.Words scans the provided font sources to get the list of available fonts. Later it may be called if the font is used in the document to parse the font data and to embed the font data to some output formats.
may be useful because it allows to load the font data only when it is required and not to store it in the memory for the lifetime.

summary.p: The Aspose.Words.Fonts namespace provides classes and enumerations to access information about fonts used in a document.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontFamily
member.summary: Represents the font family.

remarks.para: A font family is a set of fonts having common stroke width and serif characteristics.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontFamily.Auto
member.summary: Specifies a generic family name. This name is used when information about a font does not exist or does not matter. The default font is used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontFamily.Roman
member.summary: Specifies a proportional font with serifs. An example is Times New Roman.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontFamily.Swiss
member.summary: Specifies a proportional font without serifs. An example is Arial.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontFamily.Modern
member.summary: Specifies a monospace font with or without serifs. Monospace fonts are usually modern; examples include Pica, Elite, and Courier New.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontFamily.Script
member.summary: Specifies a font that is designed to look like handwriting; examples include Script and Cursive.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontFamily.Decorative
member.summary: Specifies a novelty font. An example is Old English.

Represents a collection of fonts used in a document.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fonts documentation article.

remarks.para: Items are objects.
You do not create instances of this class directly. Use the property to access the collection of fonts defined in the document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontInfoCollection.EmbedTrueTypeFonts
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to embed TrueType fonts in a document when it is saved. Default value for this property is false.

remarks.para: Embedding TrueType fonts allows others to view the document with the same fonts that were used to create it, but may substantially increase the document size.
This option works for DOC, DOCX and RTF formats only.

summary.para: Specifies whether or not to embed System fonts into the document. Default value for this property is false.
This option works only when option is set to true.

remarks.para: Setting this property to true is useful if the user is on an East Asian system and wants to create a document that is readable by others who do not have fonts for that language on their system. For example, a user on a Japanese system could choose to embed the fonts in a document so that the Japanese document would be readable on all systems.
This option works for DOC, DOCX and RTF formats only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontInfoCollection.SaveSubsetFonts

summary.para: Specifies whether or not to save a subset of the embedded TrueType fonts with the document. Default value for this property is false.
This option works only when property is set to true.

member.remarks: This option works for DOC, DOCX and RTF formats only.

member.summary: Gets or sets the character set for the font.
member.dev: Such charset code is replaced by IANA name of character set in ISO/IEC 29500. We may not know charset codes for some IANA charset names. Also there may be unknown charset codes. For example AW test documents contain the undocumented 0x4E and 0x50 codes. So, now we store the both: charset codes and charset IANA names to be able to write charset as it was read.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontInfo.Panose
member.summary: Gets or sets the PANOSE typeface classification number.

remarks.para: PANOSE is a compact 10-byte description of a fonts critical visual characteristics, such as contrast, weight, and serif style. The digits represent Family Kind, Serif Style, Weight, Proportion, Contrast, Stroke Variation, Arm Style, Letterform, Midline, and X-Height.
Can be null.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings
member.summary:
Specifies font settings for a document.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fonts documentation article.

remarks.para: Aspose.Words uses font settings to resolve the fonts in the document. Fonts are resolved mostly when building document layout or rendering to fixed page formats. But when loading some formats, Aspose.Words also may require to resolve the fonts. For example, when loading HTML documents Aspose.Words may resolve the fonts to perform font fallback. So it is recommended that you set the font settings in when loading the document. Or at least before building the layout or rendering the document to the fixed-page format.
By default all documents uses single static font settings instance. It could be accessed by property.

Changing font settings is safe at any time from any thread. But it is recommended that you do not change the font settings while processing some documents which uses this settings. This can lead to the fact that the same font will be resolved differently in different parts of the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.SetFontsFolder(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the folder where Aspose.Words looks for TrueType fonts when rendering documents or embedding fonts. This is a shortcut to for setting only one font directory.
member.param: The folder that contains TrueType fonts.
True to scan the specified folders for fonts recursively.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.SetFontsFolders(System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the folders where Aspose.Words looks for TrueType fonts when rendering documents or embedding fonts.

remarks.para: By default, Aspose.Words looks for fonts installed to the system.
Setting this property resets the cache of all previously loaded fonts.

member.param: An array of folders that contain TrueType fonts.
True to scan the specified folders for fonts recursively.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.SetFontsSources(Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSourceBase[])
member.summary: Sets the sources where Aspose.Words looks for TrueType fonts when rendering documents or embedding fonts.

remarks.para: By default, Aspose.Words looks for fonts installed to the system.
Setting this property resets the cache of all previously loaded fonts.

member.param: An array of sources that contain TrueType fonts.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.GetFontsSources
member.summary: Gets a copy of the array that contains the list of sources where Aspose.Words looks for TrueType fonts.

remarks.para: The returned value is a copy of the data that Aspose.Words uses. If you change the entries in the returned array, it will have no effect on document rendering. To specify new font sources use the method.

member.returns: A copy of the current font sources.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.ResetFontSources
member.summary: Resets the fonts sources to the system default.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.SaveSearchCache(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the font search cache to the stream.
member.param: Output stream.
member.remarks: See method description for more info.

members.member:
Sets the sources where Aspose.Words looks for TrueType fonts and additionally loads previously saved font search cache.
An array of sources that contain TrueType fonts. Input stream with saved font search cache.
Loading previously saved font search cache will speed up the font cache initialization process. It is especially useful when access to font sources is complicated (e.g. when fonts are loaded via network).
When saving and loading font search cache, fonts in the provided sources are identified via cache key. For the fonts in the and cache key is the path to the font file. For and cache key is defined in the and properties respectively. For the cache key is either property or a file path if the is null.
It is highly recommended to provide the same font sources when loading cache as at the time the cache was saved. Any changes in the font sources (e.g. adding new fonts, moving font files or changing the cache key) may lead to the inaccurate font resolving by Aspose.Words. FontSettings

member.summary: Static default font settings.
member.remarks: This instance is used by default in a document unless is specified.

member.summary: Settings related to font fallback mechanism.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fonts.FontSettings.SubstitutionSettings
member.summary: Settings related to font substitution mechanism.

summary.p: The Aspose.Words.Replacing namespace provides classes to manipulate with find/replace operations over the document tree.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions
member.summary:
Specifies options for find/replace operations.
To learn more, visit the Find and Replace documentation article.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.ApplyFont
member.summary: Text formatting applied to new content.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.ApplyParagraphFormat
member.summary: Paragraph formatting applied to new content.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.Direction
member.summary: Selects direction for replace. Default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.MatchCase
member.summary: True indicates case-sensitive comparison, false indicates case-insensitive comparison.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.FindWholeWordsOnly
member.summary: True indicates the oldValue must be a standalone word.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.ReplacingCallback
member.summary: The user-defined method which is called before every replace occurrence.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.UseLegacyOrder
member.summary: True indicates that a text search is performed sequentially from top to bottom considering the text boxes. Default value is false.
member.dev: FIX 19357. Added option.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.IgnoreDeleted
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating either to ignore text inside delete revisions. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.IgnoreInserted
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating either to ignore text inside insert revisions. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.IgnoreFields
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating either to ignore text inside fields. The default value is false.

remarks.para: This option affects whole field (all nodes between and ).
To ignore only field codes, please use corresponding option .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.IgnoreFieldCodes
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating either to ignore text inside field codes. The default value is false.

remarks.para: This option affects only field codes (it does not ignore nodes between and ).
To ignore whole field, please use corresponding option .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.IgnoreFootnotes
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating either to ignore footnotes. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.UseSubstitutions
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to recognize and use substitutions within replacement patterns. The default value is false.
member.remarks: For the details on substitution elements please refer to: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/substitutions-in-regular-expressions.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.LegacyMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating that old find/replace algorithm is used.
member.remarks: Use this flag if you need exactly the same behavior as before advanced find/replace feature was introduced. Note that old algorithm does not support advanced features such as replace with breaks, apply formatting and so on.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.IgnoreStructuredDocumentTags
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating either to ignore content of . The default value is false.

remarks.para: When this option is set to true, the content of will be treated as a simple text.
Otherwise, will be processed as standalone Story and replacing pattern will be searched separately for each , so that if pattern crosses a , then replacement will not be performed for such pattern.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceOptions.SmartParagraphBreakReplacement

summary.para: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating either it is allowed to replace paragraph break when there is no next sibling paragraph.
The default value is false.

member.remarks: This option allows to replace paragraph break when there is no next sibling paragraph to which all child nodes can be moved, by finding any (not necessarily sibling) next paragraph after the paragraph being replaced.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceDirection
member.summary: Specifies direction for replace operations.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Replacing.FindReplaceDirection.Forward
member.summary: Matched items are replaced from first to last.

member.summary: This is called to notify of document saving progress.
member.param: An argument of the event.
member.remarks:
The primary uses for this interface is to allow application code to obtain progress status and abort saving process.
An exception should be threw from the progress callback for abortion and it should be caught in the consumer code.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.CompressionLevel
member.summary:
Compression level for OOXML files.
(DOCX and DOTX files are internally a ZIP-archive, this property controls the compression level of the archive.
Note, that FlatOpc file is not a ZIP-archive, therefore, this property does not affect the FlatOpc files.)

member.summary: Normal compression level. Default compression level used by Aspose.Words.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.CompressionLevel.Maximum

member.summary: Fast compression level.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.CompressionLevel.SuperFast

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.Dml3DEffectsRenderingMode
member.summary: Specifies how 3D shape effects are rendered.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.Dml3DEffectsRenderingMode.Basic
member.summary: A lightweight and stable rendering, based on the internal engine, but advanced effects such as lighting, materials and other additional effects are not displayed when using this mode. Please see documentation for details.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.Dml3DEffectsRenderingMode.Advanced
member.summary: Rendering of an extended list of special effects including advanced 3D effects such as bevels, lighting and materials.
member.remarks: The current implementation uses OpenGL. Please make sure that OpenGL library version 1.1 or higher is installed on your system before use. This mode is still under development, and some things may not be supported, so it's recommended to use the mode if the rendering result is not acceptable. Please see documentation for details.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImlRenderingMode
member.summary: Specifies how ink (InkML) objects are rendered to fixed page formats.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImlRenderingMode.Fallback
member.summary: If fall-back shape is available for ink (InkML) object, Aspose.Words renders fall-back shape instead of the InkML.
member.remarks: Please note that after saving a document to a fixed page format with fall-back rendering mode, InkML objects in the AW document model are permanently replaced with their fall-back counterparts. As a result, saving the same document again will always use fall-back shapes, even if is set to .

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImlRenderingMode.InkML
member.summary: Aspose.Words ignores fall-back shape of ink (InkML) object and renders InkML itself. This is the default mode.

member.summary: Only bookmark in first header/footer of the section is exported.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.HeaderFooterBookmarksExportMode.All
member.summary: Bookmarks in all headers/footers are exported.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions
member.summary:
Allows to specify additional options when rendering document pages or shapes to images.
To learn more, visit the Specify Save Options documentation article.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.#ctor(Aspose.Words.SaveFormat)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class that can be used to save rendered images in the , , , , or format. , , or format.
member.param: Can be , , , , or . , , or .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.Clone
member.summary: Creates a deep clone of this object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.SaveFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format in which the rendered document pages or shapes will be saved if this save options object is used. Can be a raster , , , or vector , .

remarks.para: On different platforms, the supported formats may be different. The number of other options depends on the selected format.
Also, it is possible to save to SVG both via and via .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.PageSet
member.summary: Gets or sets the pages to render. Default is all the pages in the document.

remarks.para: This property has effect only when rendering document pages. This property is ignored when rendering shapes to images.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.PaperColor
member.summary:
Gets or sets the background (paper) color for the generated images.
The default value is .

remarks.para: When rendering pages of a document that specifies its own background color, then the document background color will override the color specified by this property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.PixelFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the pixel format for the generated images.

remarks.para: This property has effect only when saving to raster image formats.
remarks.p: The default value is .
Pixel format of the output image may differ from the set value because of work of GDI+.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.HorizontalResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal resolution for the generated images, in dots per inch.

remarks.para: This property has effect only when saving to raster image formats and affects the output size in pixels.
remarks.p: The default value is 96.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.VerticalResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical resolution for the generated images, in dots per inch.

remarks.para: This property has effect only when saving to raster image formats and affects the output size in pixels.
remarks.p: The default value is 96.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.Resolution
member.summary: Sets both horizontal and vertical resolution for the generated images, in dots per inch.

remarks.para: This property has effect only when saving to raster image formats.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.JpegQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining the quality of the generated JPEG images.

remarks.para: Has effect only when saving to JPEG.
remarks.p: Use this property to get or set the quality of generated images when saving in JPEG format. The value may vary from 0 to 100 where 0 means worst quality but maximum compression and 100 means best quality but minimum compression.
The default value is 95.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.TiffCompression
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of compression to apply when saving generated images to the TIFF format.

remarks.para: Has effect only when saving to TIFF.
remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.ImageColorMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the color mode for the generated images.

remarks.para: This property has effect only when saving to raster image formats.
The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.ImageBrightness
member.summary: Gets or sets the brightness for the generated images.

remarks.para: This property has effect only when saving to raster image formats.
The default value is 0.5. The value must be in the range between 0 and 1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.ImageContrast
member.summary: Gets or sets the contrast for the generated images.

remarks.para: This property has effect only when saving to raster image formats.
The default value is 0.5. The value must be in the range between 0 and 1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.Scale
member.summary: Gets or sets the zoom factor for the generated images.
member.remarks: The default value is 1.0. The value must be greater than 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.MetafileRenderingOptions
member.summary: Allows to specify how metafiles are treated in the rendered output.

remarks.para: When is specified, Aspose.Words renders metafile to vector graphics using its own metafile rendering engine first and then renders vector graphics to the image.
When is specified, Aspose.Words renders metafile directly to the image using the GDI+ metafile rendering engine.

GDI+ metafile rendering engine works faster, supports almost all metafile features but on low resolutions may produce inconsistent result when compared to the rest of vector graphics (especially for text) on the page. Aspose.Words metafile rendering engine will produce more consistent result even on low resolutions but works slower and may inaccurately render complex metafiles.
The default value for is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.TiffBinarizationMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets method used while converting images to 1 bpp format when is and is equal to or .

remarks.para: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.ThresholdForFloydSteinbergDithering
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold that determines the value of the binarization error in the Floyd-Steinberg method. when is .

remarks.para: The default value is 128.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.GraphicsQualityOptions
member.summary: Allows to specify rendering mode and quality for the object.

remarks.para: Use this property to override the Graphics settings provided by Aspose.Words engine by default.
It will take effect only when a document is being saved to an image-like format.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ImageSaveOptions.UseGdiEmfRenderer
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining whether to use GDI+ or Aspose.Words metafile renderer when saving to EMF.

remarks.para: If set to true GDI+ metafile renderer is used. I.e. content is written to GDI+ graphics object and saved to metafile.
If set to false Aspose.Words metafile renderer is used. I.e. content is written directly to the metafile format with Aspose.Words.
Has effect only when saving to EMF.
GDI+ saving works only on .NET.
The default value is true.

member.summary: Export list items compatible with Markdown syntax.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.PageSet
member.summary:
Describes a random set of pages.
To learn more, visit the Programming with Documents documentation article.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Saving.PageSet.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an one-page set based on exact page index.
member.param: Zero-based index of the page.
member.remarks: If a page is encountered that is not in the document, an exception will be thrown during rendering. means the last page in the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Saving.PageSet.#ctor(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Creates a page set based on exact page indices.
member.param: Zero-based indices of pages.
member.remarks: If a page is encountered that is not in the document, an exception will be thrown during rendering. means the last page in the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Saving.PageSet.#ctor(Aspose.Words.Saving.PageRange[])
member.summary: Creates a page set based on ranges.
member.param: Array of page ranges.
member.remarks: If a range is encountered that starts after the last page in the document, an exception will be thrown during rendering. All ranges that end after the last page are truncated to fit in the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Saving.PageSet.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a page set based on the page numbers and page ranges, separated by commas. For example, "3, 5-8" includes page 3 and pages 5 through 8.
member.param: String description of pages and page ranges
member.remarks: If a range or a page is encountered that starts after the last page in the document, an exception will be thrown during rendering. All ranges that end after the last page are truncated to fit in the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Saving.PageSet.#ctor(Aspose.Words.Saving.PageParity,Aspose.Words.Saving.PageRange[])
member.summary: Creates a page set based on ranges.
member.param: Parity of pages to select.
Array of page ranges
member.remarks: Even pages have odd indices and vice versa, since page indices are zero-based.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.PageSet.All
member.summary: Gets a set with all the pages of the document in their original order.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.PageSet.Even
member.summary: Gets a set with all the even pages of the document in their original order.
member.remarks: Even pages have odd indices since page indices are zero-based.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.PageSet.Odd
member.summary: Gets a set with all the odd pages of the document in their original order.
member.remarks: Odd pages have even indices since page indices are zero-based.

member.summary: A link is exported as a reference block if it has roundtrip information or is mentioned more than once in a document. In all other cases a link is exported as an inline block.

member.summary: Links are exported as inline blocks.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.MarkdownLinkExportMode.Reference

Specifies how list levels are indented when document is exporting to format.
To learn more, visit the Save a Document documentation article.

member.summary: Gets or sets how many to use as indentation per one list level. The default value is 0, that means no indentation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.TxtListIndentation.Character
member.summary: Gets or sets which character to use for indenting list levels. The default value is '\0', that means there is no indentation.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.TxtExportHeadersFootersMode
member.summary: Specifies the way headers and footers are exported to plain text format.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.TxtExportHeadersFootersMode.None
member.summary: No headers and footers are exported.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.TxtExportHeadersFootersMode.PrimaryOnly
member.summary: Only primary headers and footers are exported at the beginning and end of each section.

remarks.para: It is hard to meaningfully output headers and footers to plain text because it is not paginated.
When this mode is used, only primary headers and footers are exported at the beginning and end of each section.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.TxtExportHeadersFootersMode.AllAtEnd
member.summary: All headers and footers are placed after all section bodies at the very end of a document.
member.remarks: This mode is similar to Word.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.MarkdownSaveOptions
member.summary:
Class to specify additional options when saving a document into the format.
To learn more, visit the Specify Save Options documentation article.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Saving.MarkdownSaveOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class that can be used to save a document in the format.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MarkdownSaveOptions.SaveFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format in which the document will be saved if this save options object is used. Can only be .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MarkdownSaveOptions.TableContentAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how to align contents in tables when exporting into the format. The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MarkdownSaveOptions.ImagesFolder
member.summary: Specifies the physical folder where images are saved when exporting a document to the format. Default is an empty string.

remarks.para: When you save a in format, Aspose.Words needs to save all images embedded in the document as standalone files. allows you to specify where the images will be saved.
If you save a document into a file and provide a file name, Aspose.Words, by default, saves the images in the same folder where the document file is saved. Use to override this behavior.

If you save a document into a stream, Aspose.Words does not have a folder where to save the images, but still needs to save the images somewhere. In this case, you need to specify an accessible folder in the property.
If the folder specified by doesn't exist, it will be created automatically.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MarkdownSaveOptions.ImageSavingCallback
member.summary: Allows to control how images are saved when a document is saved to format.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MarkdownSaveOptions.ExportImagesAsBase64
member.summary: Specifies whether images are saved in Base64 format to the output file. Default value is false.

remarks.para: When this property is set to true images data are exported directly into the img elements and separate files are not created.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MarkdownSaveOptions.ListExportMode
member.summary: Specifies how list items will be written to the output file. Default value is .

remarks.para: When this property is set to all list labels are updated using and exported with their actual values. Such lists can be non-compatible with Markdown format and will be recognized as plain text upon importing in this case.
When this property is set to , writer tries to export list items in manner that allows to numerate list items in automatic mode by Markdown.

member.remarks: The property affects only page breaks that are inserted explicitly into a document. It is not related to page breaks that MS Word automatically inserts at the end of each page.

member.summary: Gets or sets used for rendering of numerals. European numerals are used by default.
member.remarks: If the value of this property is changed and page layout is already built then is invoked automatically to update any changes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.FixedPageSaveOptions.MetafileRenderingOptions
member.summary: Allows to specify metafile rendering options.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.FixedPageSaveOptions.JpegQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining the quality of the JPEG images inside Html document.

remarks.para: Has effect only when a document contains JPEG images.
remarks.p: Use this property to get or set the quality of the images inside a document when saving in fixed page format. The value may vary from 0 to 100 where 0 means worst quality but maximum compression and 100 means best quality but minimum compression.
The default value is 95.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.FixedPageSaveOptions.ColorMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how colors are rendered.
member.remarks: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.FixedPageSaveOptions.OptimizeOutput
member.summary:
Flag indicates whether it is required to optimize output. If this flag is set redundant nested canvases and empty canvases are removed, also neighbor glyphs with the same formatting are concatenated. Note: The accuracy of the content display may be affected if this property is set to true.
Default is false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlVersion
member.summary: Indicates the version of HTML is used when saving the document to and formats.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlVersion.Xhtml
member.summary: Saves the document in compliance with the XHTML 1.0 Transitional standard.

remarks.p: Aspose.Words aims to output XHTML according to the XHTML 1.0 Transitional standard, but the output will not always validate against the DTD. Some structures inside a Microsoft Word document are hard or impossible to map to a document that will validate against the XHTML schema. For example, XHTML does not allow nested lists (UL cannot be nested inside another UL element), but in Microsoft Word document multilevel lists occur quite often.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlVersion.Html5
member.summary: Saves the document in compliance with the HTML 5 standard.

Allows to specify additional quality options.

member.summary: Gets or sets text layout information (such as alignment, orientation and tab stops) display manipulations (such as ellipsis insertion and national digit substitution) and OpenType features.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.GraphicsQualityOptions.CompositingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how composited images are drawn to this Graphics.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.GraphicsQualityOptions.CompositingQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets the rendering quality of composited images drawn to this Graphics.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.GraphicsQualityOptions.InterpolationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the interpolation mode associated with this Graphics.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.GraphicsQualityOptions.SmoothingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the rendering quality for this Graphics.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.GraphicsQualityOptions.TextRenderingHint
member.summary: Gets or sets the rendering mode for text associated with this Graphics.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.GraphicsQualityOptions.UseTileFlipMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether WrapMode is TileFlipXY.

remarks.p: The specifies how a texture or gradient is tiled when it is smaller than the area being filled.
By default uses (specifies tiling without flipping). This causes inaccurate rendering of the scaled image(with high resolution).
This property allows to switch WrapMode to (specifies that tiles are flipped horizontally as you move along a row and flipped vertically as you move along a column).

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlOfficeMathOutputMode
member.summary: Specifies how Aspose.Words exports OfficeMath to HTML, MHTML and EPUB.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlOfficeMathOutputMode.Image
member.summary: OfficeMath is converted to HTML as image specified by tag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlOfficeMathOutputMode.MathML
member.summary: OfficeMath is converted to HTML using MathML.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlOfficeMathOutputMode.Text
member.summary: OfficeMath is converted to HTML as sequence of runs specified by <span> tags.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.PageSavingArgs.PageStream
member.summary: Allows to specify the stream where the document page will be saved to.

remarks.para: This property allows you to save document pages to streams instead of files.
The default value is null. When this property is null, the document page will be saved to a file specified in the property.
If both and are set, then PageStream will be used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.PageSavingArgs.KeepPageStreamOpen
member.summary: Specifies whether Aspose.Words should keep the stream open or close it after saving a document page.

remarks.para: Default is false and Aspose.Words will close the stream you provided in the property after writing a document page into it. Specify true to keep the stream open.

member.summary: Adds information about font that is uploaded to the printer by manufacturer.
member.param: Full name of the font (e.g. "Times New Roman Bold Italic").
Name of the font that is used in Pcl document.
member.remarks: There are 52 fonts that are to be built in any printer according to Pcl specification. However manufactures can add some other fonts to their devices.

member.summary: Specifies the format in which the document will be saved if this save options object is used. Can only be .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.PclSaveOptions.RasterizeTransformedElements
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining whether or not complex transformed elements should be rasterized before saving to PCL document. Default is true.
member.remarks: PCL doesn't support some kind of transformations that are used by Aspose Words. E.g. rotated, skewed images and texture brushes. To properly render such elements rasterization process is used, i.e. saving to image and clipping. This process can take additional time and memory. If flag is set to false, some content in output may be different as compared with the source document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.PclSaveOptions.FallbackFontName
member.summary: Name of the font that will be used if no expected font is found in printer and built-in fonts collections.
member.remarks: If no fallback is found, a warning is generated and "Arial" font is used.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfImageColorSpaceExportMode
member.summary: Specifies how the color space will be selected for the images in PDF document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfImageColorSpaceExportMode.Auto
member.summary: Aspose.Words automatically selects the most appropriate color space for each image.

remarks.para: Most of the images are saved in RGB color space. Also Indexed and Grayscale color spaces may be used. CMYK color space is never used.
For some images the color space may be different on different platforms.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfImageColorSpaceExportMode.SimpleCmyk
member.summary: Aspose.Words coverts RGB images to CMYK color space using simple formula.

remarks.para: Images in RGB color space are converted to CMYK using formula: Black = minimum(1-Red,1-Green,1-Blue). Cyan = (1-Red-Black)/(1-Black). Magenta = (1-Green-Black)/(1-Black). Yellow = (1-Blue-Black)/(1-Black). RGB values are normalized - they are between 0 and 1.0.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfCustomPropertiesExport
member.summary: Specifies the way are exported to PDF file.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfCustomPropertiesExport.None
member.summary: No custom properties are exported.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfCustomPropertiesExport.Standard
member.summary:
Custom properties are exported as entries in /Info dictionary.
Custom properties with the following names are not exported: "Title", "Author", "Subject", "Keywords", "Creator", "Producer", "CreationDate", "ModDate", "Trapped".

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfCustomPropertiesExport.Metadata
member.summary: Custom properties are Metadata.

remarks.para: The namespace of exported properties in XMP packet is "custprops". Every property has an associated xml-element "custprops:Property1", "custprops:Property2" and so on. There is "rdf:Description" element inside property element. The description element has two elements "custprops:Name", containing custom property's name as a value of this xml-element, and "custprops:Value", containing custom property's value as value of this xml-element.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.DmlEffectsRenderingMode

member.summary: Rendering of DrawingML effects are simplified.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.DmlEffectsRenderingMode.None
member.summary: No DrawingML effects are rendered.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.DmlEffectsRenderingMode.Fine
member.summary: DrawingML effects are rendered in fine mode which involves advanced processing. In this mode rendering of effects gives better results but at a higher performance cost than mode.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.DmlRenderingMode
member.summary: Specifies how DrawingML shapes are rendered to fixed page formats.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.DmlRenderingMode.Fallback
member.summary: If fall-back shape is available for DrawingML, Aspose.Words renders fall-back shape instead of the DrawingML.
member.remarks: Please note that after saving a document to a fixed page format with fall-back DML rendering mode, DML shapes in the AW document model are permanently replaced with their fall-back counterparts. As a result, saving the same document again will always use fall-back shapes, even if is set to .

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.DmlRenderingMode.DrawingML
member.summary: Aspose.Words ignores fall-back shape of DrawingML and renders DrawingML itself. This is the default mode.

A value of 0 means the threshold check is not used and all images that can be reduced in size are downsampled.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.ResourceSavingArgs
member.summary:
Provides data for the event.
To learn more, visit the Save a Document documentation article.

remarks.para: By default, when Aspose.Words saves a document to fixed page HTML or SVG, it saves each resource into a separate file. Aspose.Words uses the document file name and a unique number to generate unique file name for each resource found in the document.
allows to redefine how resource file names are generated or to completely circumvent saving of resources into files by providing your own stream objects.
To apply your own logic for generating resource file names use the property.
To save resources into streams instead of files, use the property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ResourceSavingArgs.Document
member.summary: Gets the document object that is currently being saved.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ResourceSavingArgs.ResourceFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the file name (without path) where the resource will be saved to.

remarks.para: This property allows you to redefine how the resource file names are generated during export to fixed page HTML or SVG.

When the event is fired, this property contains the file name that was generated by Aspose.Words. You can change the value of this property to save the resource into a different file. Note that file names must be unique.
remarks.p: Aspose.Words automatically generates a unique file name for every resource when exporting to fixed page HTML or SVG format. How the resource file name is generated depends on whether you save the document to a file or to a stream.
When saving a document to a file, the generated resource file name looks like <document base file name>.<image number>.<extension>.
When saving a document to a stream, the generated resource file name looks like Aspose.Words.<document guid>.<image number>.<extension>.
remarks.para: must contain only the file name without the path. Aspose.Words determines the path for saving and the value of the src attribute for writing to fixed page HTML or SVG using the document file name, the or and or properties.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ResourceSavingArgs.ResourceFileUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the uniform resource identifier (URI) used to reference the resource file from the document.

remarks.para: This property allows you to change URIs of resource files exported to fixed page HTML or SVG documents.

Aspose.Words automatically generates an URI for every resource file during export to fixed page HTML or SVG format. The generated URIs reference resource files saved by Aspose.Words. However, the URIs can be incorrect if resource files are to be moved to other location or if resource files are saved to streams. This property allows to correct URIs in these cases.
When the event is fired, this property contains the URI that was generated by Aspose.Words. You can change the value of this property to provide a custom URI for the resource file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ResourceSavingArgs.KeepResourceStreamOpen
member.summary: Specifies whether Aspose.Words should keep the stream open or close it after saving a resource.

remarks.para: Default is false and Aspose.Words will close the stream you provided in the property after writing a resource into it. Specify true to keep the stream open.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.ResourceSavingArgs.ResourceStream
member.summary: Allows to specify the stream where the resource will be saved to.

remarks.para: This property allows you to save resources to streams instead of files.
The default value is null. When this property is null, the resource will be saved to a file specified in the property.
Using you cannot substitute one resource with another. It is intended only for control over location where to save resources.

member.summary: Specifies the format in which the document will be saved if this save options object is used. Can only be .

member.summary: Specifies whether border around pages should be shown. Default is true.

member.summary: Specifies the horizontal alignment of pages in an HTML document. Default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlFixedSaveOptions.PageMargins
member.summary: Specifies the margins around pages in an HTML document. The margins value is measured in points and should be equal to or greater than 0. Default value is 10 points.

remarks.para: Depends on the value of property:

list.item: Defines top, bottom and left page margins if the value is .
Defines top, bottom and right page margins if the value is .
Defines top and bottom page margins if the value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlFixedSaveOptions.ResourcesFolder
member.summary: Specifies the physical folder where resources (images, fonts, css) are saved when exporting a document to Html format. Default is null.

remarks.p: Has effect only if property is false.

When you save a in Html format, Aspose.Words needs to save all images embedded in the document as standalone files. allows you to specify where the images will be saved and allows to specify how the image URIs will be constructed.
If you save a document into a file and provide a file name, Aspose.Words, by default, saves the images in the same folder where the document file is saved. Use to override this behavior.

If you save a document into a stream, Aspose.Words does not have a folder where to save the images, but still needs to save the images somewhere. In this case, you need to specify an accessible folder by using the property

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlFixedSaveOptions.ResourcesFolderAlias
member.summary: Specifies the name of the folder used to construct image URIs written into an Html document. Default is null.

remarks.p: When you save a in Html format, Aspose.Words needs to save all images embedded in the document as standalone files. allows you to specify where the images will be saved and allows to specify how the image URIs will be constructed.

member.summary: Specifies prefix which is added to all class names in style.css file. Default value is "aw".

member.summary: Allows to control how resources (images, fonts and css) are saved when a document is exported to fixed page Html format.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlFixedSaveOptions.Encoding
member.summary: Specifies the encoding to use when exporting to HTML. Default value is new UTF8Encoding(true) (UTF-8 with BOM).

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlFixedSaveOptions.ExportFormFields
member.summary: Gets or sets indication of whether form fields are exported as interactive items (as 'input' tag) rather than converted to text or graphics.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlFixedSaveOptions.OptimizeOutput
member.summary:
Flag indicates whether it is required to optimize output. If this flag is set redundant nested canvases and empty canvases are removed, also neighbor glyphs with the same formating are concatenated. Note: The accuracy of the content display may be affected if this property is set to true.
Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlFixedSaveOptions.UseTargetMachineFonts
member.summary: Flag indicates whether fonts from target machine must be used to display the document. If this flag is set to true, and properties do not have effect, also is not fired for fonts. Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.HtmlFixedSaveOptions.SaveFontFaceCssSeparately
member.summary: Flag indicates whether "@font-face" CSS rules should be placed into a separate file "fontFaces.css" when a document is being saved with external stylesheet (that is, when is false). Default value is false, all CSS rules are written into single file "styles.css".
member.remarks: Setting this property to true restores the old behavior (separate files) for compatibility with legacy code.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.BookmarksOutlineLevelCollection
member.summary:
A collection of individual bookmarks outline level.
To learn more, visit the Working with Bookmarks documentation article.

remarks.para: Key is a case-insensitive string bookmark name. Value is a int bookmark outline level.

Bookmark outline level may be a value from 0 to 9. Specify 0 and Word bookmark will not be displayed in the document outline. Specify 1 and Word bookmark will be displayed in the document outline at level 1; 2 for level 2 and so on.

remarks.para: By default, when Aspose.Words saves a document to HTML, it saves CSS information inline (as a value of the style attribute on every element).
allows to save CSS information into file by providing your own stream object.

To suppress saving CSS into a file and embedding to HTML document use the property.

member.summary: Specifies whether Aspose.Words should keep the stream open or close it after saving an CSS information.

remarks.para: Default is false and Aspose.Words will close the stream you provided in the property after writing an CSS information into it. Specify true to keep the stream open.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.CssSavingArgs.CssStream
member.summary: Allows to specify the stream where the CSS information will be saved to.

remarks.para: This property allows you to save CSS information to a stream.
The default value is null. This property doesn't suppress saving CSS information to a file or embedding to HTML document. To suppress exporting CSS use the property.
Using you cannot substitute CSS with another. It is intended only for saving CSS to a stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.CssSavingArgs.IsExportNeeded
member.summary: Allows to specify whether the CSS will be exported to file and embedded to HTML document. Default is true. When this property is false, the CSS information will not be saved to a CSS file and will not be embedded to HTML document.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.ICssSavingCallback
member.summary: Implement this interface if you want to control how Aspose.Words saves CSS (Cascading Style Sheet) when saving a document to HTML.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Saving.ICssSavingCallback.CssSaving(Aspose.Words.Saving.CssSavingArgs)
member.summary: Called when Aspose.Words saves an CSS (Cascading Style Sheet).

member.summary: Aspose.Words tries to render EMF+ part of EMF+ Dual metafile. If some of the EMF+ records are not supported then Aspose.Words renders EMF part of EMF+ Dual metafile.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.EmfPlusDualRenderingMode.EmfPlus
member.summary: Aspose.Words renders EMF+ part of EMF+ Dual metafile.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Saving.EmfPlusDualRenderingMode.Emf
member.summary: Aspose.Words renders EMF part of EMF+ Dual metafile.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.MetafileRenderingOptions
member.summary:
Allows to specify additional metafile rendering options.
To learn more, visit the Handling Windows Metafiles documentation article.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MetafileRenderingOptions.RenderingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how metafile images should be rendered.

remarks.para: The default value depends on the save format. For images it is . For other formats it is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MetafileRenderingOptions.EmfPlusDualRenderingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how EMF+ Dual metafiles should be rendered.

remarks.para: EMF+ Dual metafiles contains both EMF+ and EMF parts. MS Word and GDI+ always renders EMF+ part. Aspose.Words currently doesn't fully supports all EMF+ records and in some cases rendering result of EMF part looks better then rendering result of EMF+ part.
remarks.p: This option is used only when metafile is rendered as vector graphics. When metafile is rendered to bitmap, EMF+ part is always used.
The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MetafileRenderingOptions.UseEmfEmbeddedToWmf
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how WMF metafiles with embedded EMF metafiles should be rendered.

remarks.para: WMF metafiles could contain embedded EMF data. MS Word in most cases uses embedded EMF data. GDI+ always uses WMF data.
remarks.p: When this value is set to true, Aspose.Words uses embedded EMF data when rendering.
When this value is set to false, Aspose.Words uses WMF data when rendering.
This option is used only when metafile is rendered as vector graphics. When metafile is rendered to bitmap, WMF data is always used.
The default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MetafileRenderingOptions.EmulateRasterOperations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining whether or not the raster operations should be emulated.

remarks.para: Specific raster operations could be used in metafiles. They can not be rendered directly to vector graphics. Emulating raster operations requires partial rasterization of the resulting vector graphics which may affect the metafile rendering performance.
remarks.p: When this value is set to true, Aspose.Words emulates the raster operations. The resulting output maybe partially rasterized and performance might be slower.

When this value is set to false, Aspose.Words does not emulate the raster operations. When Aspose.Words encounters a raster operation in a metafile it fallbacks to rendering the metafile into a bitmap by using the operating system.
This option is used only when metafile is rendered as vector graphics.
The default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MetafileRenderingOptions.UseGdiRasterOperationsEmulation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining whether or not to use the GDI+ for raster operations emulation.

remarks.para: Windows GDI+ library could be used to emulate raster operations. It provides support for all raster operation comparing to Aspose.Words own emulation but performance may be slower in some cases.
remarks.p: When this value is set to true, Aspose.Words uses GDI+ for raster operations emulation.
When this value is set to false, Aspose.Words uses its own implementation of raster operations emulation.
This option is used only when metafile is rendered as vector graphics.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.MetafileRenderingOptions.ScaleWmfFontsToMetafileSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining whether or not to scale fonts in WMF metafile according to metafile size on the page.

remarks.para: When WMF metafiles are displayed in MS Word, fonts may be scaled according to actual metafile size on the page.
remarks.p: When this value is set to true, Aspose.Words emulates font scaling according to metafile size on the page.
When this value is set to false, Aspose.Words displays the fonts as metafile is rendered to its default size.
This option is used only when metafile is rendered as vector graphics.
The default value is true.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining how text should be rendered in SVG.

remarks.p: Use this property to get or set the mode of how text inside a document should be rendered when saving in SVG format.
The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.SvgSaveOptions.ResourcesFolder
member.summary: Specifies the physical folder where resources (images) are saved when exporting a document to Svg format. Default is null.

remarks.p: Has effect only if property is false.

When you save a in SVG format, Aspose.Words needs to save all images embedded in the document as standalone files. allows you to specify where the images will be saved and allows to specify how the image URIs will be constructed.
If you save a document into a file and provide a file name, Aspose.Words, by default, saves the images in the same folder where the document file is saved. Use to override this behavior.

If you save a document into a stream, Aspose.Words does not have a folder where to save the images, but still needs to save the images somewhere. In this case, you need to specify an accessible folder in the property

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.SvgSaveOptions.ResourcesFolderAlias
member.summary: Specifies the name of the folder used to construct image URIs written into an SVG document. Default is null.

remarks.p: When you save a in SVG format, Aspose.Words needs to save all images embedded in the document as standalone files. allows you to specify where the images will be saved and allows to specify how the image URIs will be constructed.

member.summary: Specifies the user password required for opening the encrypted PDF document.

remarks.para: The user password will be required to open an encrypted PDF document for viewing. The permissions specified in will be enforced by the reader software.
The user password can be null or empty string, in this case no password will be required from the user when opening the PDF document. The user password cannot be the same as the owner password.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfEncryptionDetails.OwnerPassword
member.summary: Specifies the owner password for the encrypted PDF document.

remarks.para: The owner password allows the user to open an encrypted PDF document without any access restrictions specified in .
The owner password cannot be the same as the user password.

member.summary: Print the document to a representation from which a faithful digital copy of the PDF content could be generated, based on an implementation-dependent algorithm. member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfDigitalSignatureDetails
member.summary: Contains details for signing a PDF document with a digital signature.

remarks.para: At the moment digitally signing PDF documents is only available on .NET 2.0 or higher.
To digitally sign a PDF document when it is created by Aspose.Words, set the property to a valid object and then save the document in the PDF format passing the as a parameter into the method.
Aspose.Words creates a PKCS#7 signature over the whole PDF document and uses the "Adobe.PPKMS" filter and "adbe.pkcs7.sha1" subfilter when creating a digital signature.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfDigitalSignatureDetails.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of this class.

member.summary: Initializes an instance of this class.
member.param: A certificate holder which contains the certificate itself.
The reason for signing.
The location of signing.
The date and time of signing.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Saving.PdfDigitalSignatureDetails.CertificateHolder
member.summary: Returns the certificate holder object that contains the certificate was used to sign the document.
