member.name: T:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.IMailMergeDataSourceRoot
member.summary: Implement this interface to allow mail merge from a custom data source with master-detail data.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.IMailMergeDataSourceRoot.GetDataSource(System.String)
member.summary: The Aspose.Words mail merge engine invokes this method when it encounters a beginning of a top-level mail merge region.

remarks.para: When the Aspose.Words mail merge engines populates a document with data and encounters MERGEFIELD TableStart:TableName, it invokes on this object. Your implementation needs to return a new data source object. Aspose.Words will use the returned data source to populate the mail merge region.
If a data source (table) with the specified name does not exist, your implementation should return null.

member.param: The name of the mail merge region as specified in the template document. Case-insensitive.
member.returns: A data source object that will provide access to the data records of the specified table.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.IMailMergeDataSource
member.summary: Implement this interface to allow mail merge from a custom data source, such as a list of objects. Master-detail data is also supported.

remarks.para: When a data source is created, it should be initialized to point to BOF (before the first record). The Aspose.Words mail merge engine will invoke to advance to next record and then invoke for every merge field it encounters in the document or the current mail merge region.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.IMailMergeDataSource.MoveNext
member.summary: Advances to the next record in the data source.
member.returns: true if moved to next record successfully; false if reached end of the data source.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.IMailMergeDataSource.GetValue(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Returns a value for the specified field name or false if the field is not found.
member.param: The name of the data field.
Returns the field value.
member.returns: true if value was found.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.IMailMergeDataSource.GetChildDataSource(System.String)
member.summary: The Aspose.Words mail merge engine invokes this method when it encounters a beginning of a nested mail merge region.

remarks.para: When the Aspose.Words mail merge engines populates a mail merge region with data and encounters the beginning of a nested mail merge region in the form of MERGEFIELD TableStart:TableName, it invokes on the current data source object. Your implementation needs to return a new data source object that will provide access to the child records of the current parent record. Aspose.Words will use the returned data source to populate the nested mail merge region.
Below are the rules that the implementation of must follow.

If the table that is represented by this data source object has a related child (detail) table with the specified name, then your implementation needs to return a new object that will provide access to the child records of the current record.
An example of this is Orders / OrderDetails relationship. Let's assume that the current object represents the Orders table and it has a current order record. Next, Aspose.Words encounters "MERGEFIELD TableStart:OrderDetails" in the document and invokes . You need to create and return a object that will allow Aspose.Words to access the OrderDetails record for the current order.
If this data source object does not have a relation to the table with the specified name, then you need to return a object that will provide access to all records of the specified table.
If a table with the specified name does not exist, your implementation should return null.

member.param: The name of the mail merge region as specified in the template document. Case-insensitive.
member.returns: A data source object that will provide access to the data records of the specified table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.IMailMergeDataSource.TableName
member.summary: Returns the name of the data source.

remarks.p: If you are implementing , return the name of the data source from this property.

Aspose.Words uses this name to match against the mail merge region name specified in the template document. The comparison between the data source name and the mail merge region name is not case sensitive.

member.returns: The name of the data source. Empty string if the data source has no name.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge
member.summary:
Represents the mail merge functionality.
To learn more, visit the Mail Merge and Reporting documentation article.

remarks.p: For mail merge operation to work, the document should contain Word MERGEFIELD and optionally NEXT fields. During mail merge operation, merge fields in the document are replaced with values from your data source.
There are two distinct ways to use mail merge: with mail merge regions and without.

The simplest mail merge is without regions and it is very similar to how mail merge works in Word. Use Execute methods to merge information from some data source such as DataTable, DataSet, DataView, IDataReader or an array of objects into your document. The object processes all records of the data source and copies and appends content of the whole document for each record.
Note that when object encounters a NEXT field, it selects next record in the data source and continues merging without copying any content.
Use and other overloads to merge information into a document with mail merge regions defined. You can use DataSet, DataTable, DataView or IDataReader as data sources for this operation.
You need to use mail merge regions if you want to dynamically grow portions inside the document. Without mail merge regions whole document will be repeated for every record of the data source.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.Execute(Aspose.Words.MailMerging.IMailMergeDataSource)
member.summary: Performs a mail merge from a custom data source.

remarks.p: Use this method to fill mail merge fields in the document with values from any data source such as a list or hashtable or objects. You need to write your own class that implements the interface.
You can use this method only when is false, that is you do not need Right-To-Left language (such as Arabic or Hebrew) compatibility.
This method ignores the option.

member.param: An object that implements the custom mail merge data source interface.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.Execute(Aspose.Words.MailMerging.IMailMergeDataSourceCore)
member.summary: Performs a mail merge from a custom data source.

remarks.p: Use this method to fill mail merge fields in the document with values from any data source such as a list or hashtable or objects. You need to write your own class that implements the interface.
You should use this method when is true, that is when you need Right-To-Left language (such as Arabic or Hebrew) compatibility. There are no other benefits from using of instead of .
This method ignores the option.

member.param: An object that implements the custom mail merge data source interface.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.Execute(System.String[],System.Object[])
member.overloads: Performs a mail merge operation.
member.summary: Performs a mail merge operation for a single record.

remarks.p: Use this method to fill mail merge fields in the document with values from an array of objects.
This method merges data for one record only. The array of field names and the array of values represent the data of a single record.
This method does not use mail merge regions.
This method ignores the option.

member.param: Array of merge field names. Field names are not case sensitive. If a field name that is not found in the document is encountered, it is ignored.
Array of values to be inserted into the merge fields. Number of elements in this array must be the same as the number of elements in .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.Execute(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Performs mail merge from a DataTable into the document.

remarks.p: Use this method to fill mail merge fields in the document with values from a DataTable.
All records from the table are merged into the document.
You can use NEXT field in the Word document to cause object to select next record from the DataTable and continue merging. This can be used when creating documents such as mailing labels.

When object reaches end of the main document and there are still more rows in the DataTable, it copies entire content of the main document and appends it to the end of the destination document using a section break as a separator.
This method ignores the option.

member.param: Table that contains data to be inserted into mail merge fields. Field names are not case sensitive. If a field name that is not found in the document is encountered, it is ignored.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.ExecuteADO(System.Object)
member.summary: Performs mail merge from an ADO Recordset object into the document.

remarks.p: This method is useful when you intend to use Aspose.Words classes as COM objects from unmanaged code such as an application built using ASP or Visual Basic 6.0.
This method ignores the option.
For more information see description of .

example.code:
[VBScript]
Dim RS Set RS = CreateObject("ADODB.Recordset") RS.Open _ "SELECT TOP 50 * FROM Customers ORDER BY Country, CompanyName", _ "Provider=Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0;Data Source=Northwind.mdb"
Dim License Set License = CreateObject("Aspose.Words.License") License.SetLicense "C:\MyPath\MyLicense.lic"
Dim Helper Set Helper = CreateObject("Aspose.Words.ComHelper") Dim Doc Set Doc = Helper.Open("CustomerLabels.doc")
Doc.MailMerge.ExecuteADO RS Doc.Save "C:\MyPath\CustomerLabels Out VBScript.doc"

member.param: ADO Recordset or Record object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.Execute(System.Data.IDataReader)
member.summary: Performs mail merge from IDataReader into the document.

remarks.p: You can pass SqlDataReader or OleDbDataReader object into this method as a parameter because they both implemented IDataReader interface.
Note this method does not use mail merge regions and for multiple records the document will grow by repeating the whole document.
This method ignores the option.

member.param: Data source for the mail merge operation.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.Execute(System.Data.DataView)
member.summary: Performs mail merge from a DataView into the document.

remarks.p: This method is useful if you retrieve data into a DataTable but then need to apply a filter or sort before the mail merge.
Note this method does not use mail merge regions and for multiple records the document will grow by repeating the whole document.
This method ignores the option.

member.param: Data source for the mail merge operation.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.Execute(System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: Performs mail merge from a DataRow into the document.

remarks.p: Use this method to fill mail merge fields in the document with values from a DataRow.
This method ignores the option.

member.param: Row that contains data to be inserted into mail merge fields. Field names are not case sensitive. If a field name that is not found in the document is encountered, it is ignored.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.ExecuteWithRegions(Aspose.Words.MailMerging.IMailMergeDataSource)
member.summary: Performs a mail merge from a custom data source with mail merge regions.

remarks.p: Use this method to fill mail merge fields in the document with values from any custom data source such as an XML file or collections of business objects. You need to write your own class that implements the interface.
You can use this method only when is false, that is you do not need Right-To-Left language (such as Arabic or Hebrew) compatibility.

member.param: An object that implements the custom mail merge data source interface.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.ExecuteWithRegions(System.Data.DataSet)
member.overloads: Performs a mail merge operation into a document with mail merge regions. Supports parent-child (master-detail) data sources and nested mail merge regions.
member.summary: Performs mail merge from a DataSet into a document with mail merge regions.

remarks.p: Use this method to perform mail merge from one or more tables into repeatable mail merge regions in the document. The mail merge regions inside the document will dynamically grow to accommodate records in the corresponding tables.
Every table in the DataSet must have a name.
The document must have mail merge regions defined with names that refer to the tables in the DataSet.
To specify a mail merge region in the document you need to insert two mail merge fields to mark beginning and end of the mail merge region.
All document content that is included inside a mail merge region will be automatically repeated for every record in the DataTable.
To mark beginning of a mail merge region insert a MERGEFIELD with name TableStart:MyTable, where MyTable corresponds to one of the table names in your DataSet.
To mark the end of the mail merge region insert another MERGEFIELD with name TableEnd:MyTable.
To insert a MERGEFIELD in Word use Insert/Field command and select MergeField then type the name of the field.
The TableStart and TableEnd fields must be inside the same section in your document.
If used inside a table, TableStart and TableEnd must be inside the same row in the table.
Mail merge regions in a document should be well formed (there always needs to be a pair of matching TableStart and TableEnd merge fields with the same table name).

member.param: DataSet that contains data to be inserted into mail merge fields.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.ExecuteWithRegions(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Performs mail merge from a DataTable into the document with mail merge regions.

remarks.p: The document must have a mail merge region defined with name that matches .
If there are other mail merge regions defined in the document they are left intact. This allows to perform several mail merge operations.

member.param: Data source for the mail merge operation. The table must have its property set.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.ExecuteWithRegionsADO(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Performs mail merge from an ADO Recordset object into the document with mail merge regions.

remarks.p: This method is useful when you intend to use Aspose.Words classes as COM objects from unmanaged code such as an application built using ASP or Visual Basic 6.0.
For more information see description of .

example.code:
[VBScript]
Dim RS Set RS = CreateObject("ADODB.Recordset") RS.Open _ "SELECT * FROM AsposeWordOrderDetails WHERE OrderId = 10444 ORDER BY ProductID", _ "Provider=Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0;Data Source=Northwind.mdb"
Dim Helper Set Helper = CreateObject("Aspose.Words.ComHelper")
Dim Doc Set Doc = Helper.Open("Invoice.doc")
Doc.MailMerge.ExecuteWithRegionsADO RS, "OrderDetails" Doc.Save "Invoice Out VBScript.doc"

member.param: ADO Recordset or Record object.
Name of the mail merge region in the document to populate.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.ExecuteWithRegions(System.Data.DataView)
member.summary: Performs mail merge from a DataView into the document with mail merge regions.

remarks.p: This method is useful if you retrieve data into a DataTable but then need to apply a filter or sort before the mail merge.
The document must have a mail merge region defined with name that matches DataView.Table.TableName.
If there are other mail merge regions defined in the document they are left intact. This allows to perform several mail merge operations.

member.param: Data source for the mail merge operation. The source table of the DataView must have its TableName property set.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.ExecuteWithRegions(System.Data.IDataReader,System.String)
member.summary: Performs mail merge from IDataReader into the document with mail merge regions.

remarks.p: You can pass SqlDataReader or OleDbDataReader object into this method as a parameter because they both implemented IDataReader interface.

member.param: Source of the data records for mail merge such as OleDbDataReader or SqlDataReader.
Name of the mail merge region in the document to populate.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.MailMerge.UseNonMergeFields
member.summary: When true, specifies that in addition to MERGEFIELD fields, mail merge is performed into some other types of fields and also into "{{fieldName}}" tags.

remarks.p: Normally, mail merge is only performed into MERGEFIELD fields, but several customers had their reporting built using other fields and had many documents created this way. To simplify migration (and because this approach was independently used by several customers) the ability to mail merge into other fields was introduced.
When is set to true, Aspose.Words will perform mail merge into the following fields:
MERGEFIELD FieldName
MACROBUTTON NOMACRO FieldName
IF 0 = 0 "{FieldName}" ""
Also, when is set to true, Aspose.Words will perform mail merge into text tags "{{fieldName}}". These are not fields, but just text tags.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.FieldMergingArgs
member.summary:
Provides data for the MergeField event.
To learn more, visit the Mail Merge and Reporting documentation article.

remarks.p: The MergeField event occurs during mail merge when a simple mail merge field is encountered in the document. You can respond to this event to return text for the mail merge engine to insert into the document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.FieldMergingArgs.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that will be inserted into the document for the current merge field.

remarks.p: When your event handler is called, this property is set to null.
If you leave Text as null, the mail merge engine will insert in place of the merge field.
If you set Text to any string (including empty), the string will be inserted into the document in place of the merge field.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.IFieldMergingCallback.ImageFieldMerging(Aspose.Words.MailMerging.ImageFieldMergingArgs)
member.summary: Called when the Aspose.Words mail merge engine is about to insert an image into a merge field.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.ImageFieldMergingArgs
member.summary:
Provides data for the event.
To learn more, visit the Mail Merge and Reporting documentation article.

remarks.p: This event occurs during mail merge when an image mail merge field is encountered in the document. You can respond to this event to return a file name, stream, or an object to the mail merge engine so it is inserted into the document.
There are three properties available , and to specify where the image must be taken from. Set only one of these properties.
To insert an image mail merge field into a document in Word, select Insert/Field command, then select MergeField and type Image:MyFieldName.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.ImageFieldMergingArgs.ImageFileName
member.summary: Sets the file name of the image that the mail merge engine must insert into the document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.ImageFieldMergingArgs.ImageStream
member.summary: Specifies the stream for the mail merge engine to read an image from.

remarks.p: Aspose.Words closes this stream after it merges the image into the document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.ImageFieldMergingArgs.Image
member.summary: Specifies the image that the mail merge engine must insert into the document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.ImageFieldMergingArgs.Shape
member.summary: Specifies the shape that the mail merge engine must insert into the document.

remarks.p: When this property is specified, the mail merge engine ignores all other properties like or and simply inserts the shape into the document.

Use this property to fully control the process of merging an image merge field. For example, you can specify or any other shape property to fine tune the resulting node. However, please note that you are responsible for providing the content of the shape.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.ImageFieldMergingArgs.ImageWidth
member.summary: Specifies the image width for the image to insert into the document.

remarks.para: The value of this property initially comes from the corresponding MERGEFIELD's code, contained in the template document. To override the initial value, you should assign an instance of class to this property or set the properties for the instance of class, returned by this property.

To indicate that the original value of the image width should be applied, you should assign the null value to this property or set the property for the instance of class, returned by this property, to a negative value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.MailMerging.ImageFieldMergingArgs.ImageHeight
member.summary: Specifies the image height for the image to insert into the document.

remarks.para: The value of this property initially comes from the corresponding MERGEFIELD's code, contained in the template document. To override the initial value, you should assign an instance of class to this property or set the properties for the instance of class, returned by this property.

To indicate that the original value of the image height should be applied, you should assign the null value to this property or set the property for the instance of class, returned by this property, to a negative value.

summary.p: The Aspose.Words.MailMerging namespace contains classes of the "original" mail merge reporting engine.
This reporting engine requires the document to be marked up with Microsoft Word mail merge fields, but supports more functionality than Microsoft Word's mail merge.
The engine allows to quickly and easily populate a report template with data from various sources such as DataTable, DataSet, DataView, IDataReader or an array of values.
The object which provides access to the reporting functionality is available via the Document.MailMerge property.
For the newer and more advanced reporting engine based on the LINQ method syntax see .

member.summary:
Allows to specify additional options when loading CHM document into a object.
To learn more, visit the Specify Load Options documentation article.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class with default values.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class with instance.

member.summary: Copy constructor.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Loading.ChmLoadOptions.OriginalFileName
member.summary: The name of the CHM file. Default value is null.

remarks.para: CHM documents may contain links that reference the same document by file name. Aspose.Words supports such links and normally uses to check whether the file referenced by a link is the file that is being loaded. If a document is loaded from a stream, its original file name should be specified explicitly via this property, since it cannot be determined automatically.
If a CHM document is loaded from a file and a non-null value for this property is specified, the value will take priority over the actual name of the file stored in .

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Loading.BlockImportMode
member.summary: Specifies how properties of block-level elements are imported from HTML-based documents.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Loading.BlockImportMode.Merge
member.summary: Properties of parent blocks are merged and stored on child elements (i.e. paragraphs or tables).

remarks.para: Properties of parent blocks are merged as follows: margins are added together; borders of higher-level blocks are discarded and only the most inner-level borders are preserved. As a result, when this mode is specified, some formatting of blocks from the original document will be lost.
On the other hand, since all merged block-level properties are stored on document nodes, all formating in the resulting document will be available for modification.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Loading.BlockImportMode.Preserve
member.summary: Properties of parent blocks are imported to a special logical structure and are stored separately from document nodes.

remarks.para: Only margins and borders of 'body', 'div', and 'blockquote' HTML elements are imported. Properties of each HTML element are stored individually.

This mode allows to better preserve borders and margins seen in the HTML document and get better conversion results. The downside is that the resulting document gets harder to modify, since borders and margins stored in the logical structure are not available for editing.
This mode mimics MS Word's behavior regarding import of block properties.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Loading.TxtLoadOptions.DetectNumberingWithWhitespaces
member.summary: Allows to specify how numbered list items are recognized when document is imported from plain text format. The default value is true.

remarks.para: If this option is set to false, lists recognition algorithm detects list paragraphs, when list numbers ends with either dot, right bracket or bullet symbols (such as "•", "*", "-" or "o").
If this option is set to true, whitespaces are also used as list number delimiters: list recognition algorithm for Arabic style numbering (1., 1.1.2.) uses both whitespaces and dot (".") symbols.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Loading.HtmlLoadOptions.PreferredControlType
member.summary: Gets or sets preferred type of document nodes that will represent imported <input> and <select> elements. Default value is .
member.remarks: Please note that setting this property does not guarantee that all imported controls will be of the specified type. If an HTML control is not representable with document nodes of the preferred type, Aspose.Words will use a compatible for that control.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Loading.HtmlLoadOptions.IgnoreNoscriptElements
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to ignore <noscript> HTML elements. Default value is false.
member.remarks: Like MS Word, Aspose.Words does not support scripts and by default loads content of <noscript> elements into the resulting document. In most browsers, however, scripts are supported and content from <noscript> is not visible. Setting this property to true forces Aspose.Words to ignore all <noscript> elements and helps to produce documents that look closer to what is seen in browsers.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Loading.HtmlLoadOptions.ConvertSvgToEmf
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to convert loaded SVG images to the EMF format. Default value is false and, if possible, loaded SVG images are stored as is without conversion.

remarks.para: Newer versions of MS Word support SVG images natively. If the MS Word version specified in load options supports SVG, Aspose.Words will store SVG images as is without conversion. If SVG is not supported, loaded SVG images will be converted to the EMF format.
If, however, this option is set to true, Aspose.Words will convert loaded SVG images to EMF even if SVG images are supported by the specified version of MS Word.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Loading.HtmlLoadOptions.BlockImportMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how properties of block-level elements are imported. Default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Loading.LoadOptions.LoadFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format of the document to be loaded. Default is .

remarks.para: It is recommended that you specify the value and let Aspose.Words detect the file format automatically. If you know the format of the document you are about to load, you can specify the format explicitly and this will slightly reduce the loading time by the overhead associated with auto detecting the format. If you specify an explicit load format and it will turn out to be wrong, the auto detection will be invoked and a second attempt to load the file will be made.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Loading.LoadOptions.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password for opening an encrypted document. Can be null or empty string. Default is null.

remarks.para: You need to know the password to open an encrypted document. If the document is not encrypted, set this to null or empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Loading.LoadOptions.BaseUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that will be used to resolve relative URIs found in the document into absolute URIs when required. Can be null or empty string. Default is null.

remarks.p: This property is used to resolve relative URIs into absolute in the following cases:

list.item: When loading an HTML document from a stream and the document contains images with relative URIs and does not have a base URI specified in the BASE HTML element.
When saving a document to PDF and other formats, to retrieve images linked using relative URIs so the images can be saved into the output document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Loading.LoadOptions.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the encoding that will be used to load an HTML, TXT, or CHM document if the encoding is not specified inside the document. Can be null. Default is null.

remarks.para: This property is used only when loading HTML, TXT, or CHM documents.
If encoding is not specified inside the document and this property is null, then the system will try to automatically detect the encoding.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Loading.LoadOptions.PreserveIncludePictureField
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to preserve the INCLUDEPICTURE field when reading Microsoft Word formats. The default value is false.

remarks.p: By default, the INCLUDEPICTURE field is converted into a shape object. You can override that if you need the field to be preserved, for example, if you wish to update it programmatically. Note however that this approach is not common for Aspose.Words. Use it on your own risk.
One of the possible use cases may be using a MERGEFIELD as a child field to dynamically change the source path of the picture. In this case you need the INCLUDEPICTURE to be preserved in the model.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Lists.List
member.summary:
Represents formatting of a list.
To learn more, visit the Working with Lists documentation article.

remarks.p: A list in a Microsoft Word document is a set of list formatting properties. Each list can have up to 9 levels and formatting properties, such as number style, start value, indent, tab position etc are defined separately for each level.
A object always belongs to the collection.
To create a new list, use the Add methods of the collection.
To modify formatting of a list, use objects found in the collection.
To apply or remove list formatting from a paragraph, use .

A list that is a definition of a list style cannot be applied directly to paragraphs to make them numbered.

A list could be a definition of a list style, in this case will be true. Such a list cannot be applied to paragraphs in the document directly.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListLevel.NumberFormat
member.summary: Returns or sets the number format for the list level.

remarks.p: Among normal text characters, the string can contain placeholder characters \x0000 to \x0008 representing the numbers from the corresponding list levels.

For example, the string "\x0000.\x0001)" will generate a list label that looks something like "1.5)". The number "1" is the current number from the 1st list level, the number "5" is the current number from the 2nd list level.
Null is not allowed, but an empty string meaning no number is valid.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListCollection
member.summary:
Stores and manages formatting of bulleted and numbered lists used in a document.
To learn more, visit the Working with Lists documentation article.

remarks.p: A list in a Microsoft Word document is a set of list formatting properties. The formatting of the lists is stored in the collection separately from the paragraphs of text.
You do not create objects of this class. There is always only one object per document and it is accessible via the property.
To create a new list based on a predefined list template or based on a list style, use the method.
To create a new list with formatting identical to an existing list, use the method.
To make a paragraph bulleted or numbered, you need to apply list formatting to a paragraph by assigning a object to the property of .
To remove list formatting from a paragraph, use the method.

If you know a bit about WordprocessingML, then you might know it defines separate concepts for "list" and "list definition". This exactly corresponds to how list formatting is stored in a Microsoft Word document at the low level. List definition is like a "schema" and list is like an instance of a list definition.

To simplify programming model, Aspose.Words hides the distinction between list and list definition in much the same way like Microsoft Word hides this in its user interface. This allows you to concentrate more on how you want your document to look like, rather than building low-level objects to satisfy requirements of the Microsoft Word file format.
It is not possible to delete lists once they are created in the current version of Aspose.Words. This is similar to Microsoft Word where user does not have explicit control over list definitions.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets the enumerator object that will enumerate lists in the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListCollection.Add(Aspose.Words.Lists.ListTemplate)
member.overloads: Creates a new list and adds it to the collection of lists in the document.
member.summary: Creates a new list based on a predefined template and adds it to the collection of lists in the document.
member.param: The template of the list.
member.returns: The newly created list.

remarks.p: Aspose.Words list templates correspond to the 21 list templates available in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word 2003.
All lists created using this method have 9 list levels.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListCollection.Add(Aspose.Words.Style)
member.summary: Creates a new list that references a list style and adds it to the collection of lists in the document.
member.param: The list style.
member.returns: The newly created list.

remarks.p: The newly created list references the list style. If you change the properties of the list style, it is reflected in the properties of the list. Vice versa, if you change the properties of the list, it is reflected in the properties of the list style.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListCollection.AddCopy(Aspose.Words.Lists.List)
member.summary: Creates a new list by copying the specified list and adding it to the collection of lists in the document.
member.param: The source list to copy from.
member.returns: The newly created list.

remarks.p: The source list can be from any document. If the source list belongs to a different document, a copy of the list is created and added to the current document.
If the source list is a reference to or a definition of a list style, the newly created list is not related to the original list style.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListCollection.AddCopy(Aspose.Words.Lists.List,System.Boolean)

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListTemplate
member.summary: Specifies one of the predefined list formats available in Microsoft Word.

remarks.p: A list template value is used as a parameter into the method.
Aspose.Words list templates correspond to the 21 list templates available in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word 2003.

summary.p: Default bulleted list with 9 levels. Bullet of the first level is a disc, bullet of the second level is a circle, bullet of the third level is a square. Then formatting repeats for the remaining levels.
Each level is indented to the right by 0.25" relative to the previous level.
Corresponds to the 1st bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

summary.p: The Aspose.Words.Lists namespace contains classes for working with bulleted and numbered lists defined in a document.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListFormat
member.summary:
Allows to control what list formatting is applied to a paragraph.
To learn more, visit the Working with Lists documentation article.

remarks.p: A paragraph in a Microsoft Word document can be bulleted or numbered. When a paragraph is bulleted or numbered, it is said that list formatting is applied to the paragraph.

You do not create objects of the class directly. You access as a property of another object that can have list formatting associated with it. At the moment the objects that can have list formatting are: , and .
of a specifies what list formatting and list level is applied to that particular paragraph.
of a (applicable to paragraph styles only) allows to specify what list formatting and list level is applied to all paragraphs of that particular style.
of a provides access to the list formatting at the current cursor position inside the .
The list formatting itself is stored inside a object that is stored separately from the paragraphs. The list objects are stored inside a collection. There is a single collection per .

The paragraphs do not physically belong to a list. The paragraphs just reference a particular list object via the property and a particular level in the list via the property. By setting these two properties you control what bullets and numbering is applied to a paragraph.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListFormat.ApplyBulletDefault
member.summary: Starts a new default bulleted list and applies it to the paragraph.

remarks.p: This is a shortcut method that creates a new list using the default bulleted template, applies it to the paragraph and selects the 1st list level.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListFormat.ApplyNumberDefault
member.summary: Starts a new default numbered list and applies it to the paragraph.

remarks.p: This is a shortcut method that creates a new list using the default numbered template, applies it to the paragraph and selects the 1st list level.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListFormat.RemoveNumbers
member.summary: Removes numbers or bullets from the current paragraph and sets list level to zero.

remarks.p: Calling this method is equivalent to setting the property to null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListFormat.ListIndent
member.summary: Increases the list level of the current paragraph by one level.

remarks.p: This method changes the list level and applies formatting properties of the new level.
In Word documents, lists may consist of up to nine levels. List formatting for each level specifies what bullet or number is used, left indent, space between the bullet and text etc.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListFormat.ListOutdent
member.summary: Decreases the list level of the current paragraph by one level.

remarks.p: This method changes the list level and applies formatting properties of the new level.
In Word documents, lists may consist of up to nine levels. List formatting for each level specifies what bullet or number is used, left indent, space between the bullet and text etc.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListFormat.ListLevelNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the list level number (0 to 8) for the paragraph.

remarks.p: In Word documents, lists may consist of 1 or 9 levels, numbered 0 to 8.
Has effect only when the property is set to reference a valid list.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListFormat.IsListItem
member.summary: True when the paragraph has bulleted or numbered formatting applied to it.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListFormat.List
member.summary: Gets or sets the list this paragraph is a member of.

remarks.p: The list that is being assigned to this property must belong to the current document.
The list that is being assigned to this property must not be a list style definition.
Setting this property to null removes bullets and numbering from the paragraph and sets the list level number to zero. Setting this property to null is equivalent to calling .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListFormat.ListLevel
member.summary: Returns the list level formatting plus any formatting overrides applied to the current paragraph.

summary.para: The Aspose.Words.Framesets namespace provides classes and enumerations that represents a frames page or a single frame on a frames page.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Framesets.Frameset
member.summary:
Represents a frames page or a single frame on a frames page.
To learn more, visit the Programming with Documents documentation article.
member.remarks: If the property contains items, this instance is a frames page, otherwise it is a single frame.
member.dev:
The class represents both ordinary frame (window) and frameset (set of frames).
I don't like to split this class into separate classes for frame and frameset in two reasons: - It simplifies reader because DOC uses one structure to defines them both. - Proposed public API seems to has imitate Word's behavior i.e. split frame into two frames so is seems to me that dynamic frame type (Frame/Frameset) is better approach.
RK I am happy with this design. We are not making it public yet, so we can tweak things later if needed. An interesting observation in MS Word Automation this is called Frameset, not Frame. They use Frameset to represent functionality of both a single frame and a frameset. Maybe we should call this Frameset too?
Just in case we want to make our Frameset to look more like MS Word Automation Frameset here is how MS Word looks like: Frameset ChildFramesetCount ChildFramesetItem
FrameDefaultURL FrameDisplayBorders FrameLinkToFile FrameName FrameResizable FrameScrollbarType
FramesetBorderColor FramesetBorderWidth
Height HeightType
ParentFrameset
Type (frame/frameset)
Width WidthType
AddNewFrame (top, bottom. left or right) Delete - deletes this frameset object

member.summary: Gets or sets the web page URL or document file name to display in this frame.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the web page or document file name specified in the property is an external resource the frame is linked with.

member.summary: Specifies comments on the digital signature. Default value is empty string ().

member.summary: The date of signing. Default value is current time ().

member.summary: Signature line identifier. Default value is Empty (all zeroes) Guid.
member.remarks: When set, it associates with corresponding .

member.summary: The image that will be shown in associated . Default value is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.DigitalSignatures.SignOptions.DecryptionPassword
member.summary: The password to decrypt source document. Default value is empty string ().
member.remarks: If OOXML document is encrypted, you should provide decryption password to decrypt source document before it will be signed. This is not required for documents in binary DOC format.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.DigitalSignatures.SignOptions.ProviderId
member.summary: Specifies the class ID of the signature provider. Default value is Empty (all zeroes) Guid.

remarks.para: The cryptographic service provider (CSP) is an independent software module that actually performs cryptography algorithms for authentication, encoding, and encryption. MS Office reserves the value of {00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} for its default signature provider.
The GUID of the additionally installed provider should be obtained from the documentation shipped with the provider.

In addition, all the installed cryptographic providers are enumerated in windows registry. It can be found in the following path: HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Cryptography\Defaults\Provider. There is a key name "CP Service UUID" which corresponds to a GUID of signature provider.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldCollection
member.summary:
A collection of objects that represents the fields in the specified range.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fields documentation article.

remarks.p: An instance of this collection iterates fields which start fall within the specified range.
The collection does not own the fields it contains, rather, is just a selection of fields.
The collection is "live", i.e. changes to the children of the node object that it was created from are immediately reflected in the fields returned by the properties and methods.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldCollection.Remove(Aspose.Words.Fields.Field)
member.summary: Removes the specified field from this collection and from the document.
member.param: A field to remove.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a field at the specified index from this collection and from the document.
member.param: An index into the collection.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldCollection.Remove(Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldStart)
member.summary: Removes the whole field by the specified field start.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldCollection.Clear
member.summary: Removes all fields of this collection from the document and from this collection itself.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldCollection.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of the fields in the collection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a field at the specified index.

remarks.p: The index is zero-based.
Negative indexes are allowed and indicate access from the back of the collection. For example -1 means the last item, -2 means the second before last and so on.
If index is greater than or equal to the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.
If index is negative and its absolute value is greater than the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.

member.param: An index into the collection.

member.summary:
Implements the SKIPIF field.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fields documentation article.
member.remarks: Compares the values designated by the expressions and in comparison using the operator designated by . If the comparison is true, SKIPIF cancels the current merge document, moves to the next data record in the data source, and starts a new merge document. If the comparison is false, the current merge document is continued.

member.summary: When implemented, returns a response from the user on prompting. Your implementation should return null to indicate that the user has not responded to the prompt (i.e. the user has pressed the Cancel button in the prompt window).

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions
member.summary:
Represents options to control field handling in a document.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fields documentation article.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.FieldUpdateCultureSource
member.summary: Specifies what culture to use to format the field result.

remarks.para: By default, the culture of the current thread is used.
The setting affects only date/time fields with \\@ format switch.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.FieldUpdateCultureProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets a provider that returns a culture object specific for each particular field.

remarks.para: The provider is requested when the value of is .
If the provider is present, then the culture object it returns is used for the field update. Otherwise, a system culture is used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.IsBidiTextSupportedOnUpdate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether bidirectional text is fully supported during field update or not.

remarks.para: When this property is set to true, additional steps are performed to produce Right-To-Left language (i.e. Arabic or Hebrew) compatible field result during its update.
When this property is set to false and Right-To-Left language is used, correctness of field result after its update is not guaranteed.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.UserPromptRespondent
member.summary: Gets or sets the respondent to user prompts during field update.

remarks.para: If the value of this property is set to null, the fields that require user response on prompting (such as or ) are not updated.
The default value is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.ComparisonExpressionEvaluator
member.summary: Gets or sets the field comparison expressions evaluator.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.DefaultDocumentAuthor
member.summary: Gets or sets default document author's name. If author's name is already specified in built-in document properties, this option is not considered.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.CustomTocStyleSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets custom style separator for the \t switch in field.
member.remarks: By default, custom styles defined by the \t switch in the field are separated by a delimiter taken from the current culture. This property overrides that behaviour by specifying a user defined delimiter.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.LegacyNumberFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether legacy (early than AW 13.10) number format for fields is enabled or not.

remarks.para: When this property is set to true, template symbol "#" worked as in .net: Replaces the pound sign with the corresponding digit if one is present; otherwise, no symbols appears in the result string.

When this property is set to false, template symbol "#" works as MS Word: This format item specifies the requisite numeric places to display in the result. If the result does not include a digit in that place, MS Word displays a space. For example, { = 9 + 6 \# $### } displays $ 15.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.UseInvariantCultureNumberFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating that number format is parsed using invariant culture or not

remarks.para: When this property is set to true, number format is taken from an invariant culture.
When this property is set to false, number format is taken from the current thread's culture.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.BarcodeGenerator
member.summary: Gets or set custom barcode generator.
member.remarks: Custom barcode generator should implement public interface .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.FieldDatabaseProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets a provider that returns a query result for the field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.PreProcessCulture
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture to preprocess field values.

remarks.p: Currently this property only affects value of the field.
The default value is null. When this property is set to null, the field's value is preprocessed with the culture controlled by the property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.CurrentUser
member.summary: Gets or sets the current user information.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.ToaCategories
member.summary: Gets or sets the table of authorities categories.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.FieldIndexFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a that represents the formatting for the fields in the document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the file name of the document.

remarks.p: This property is used by the field with higher priority than the property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.TemplateName
member.summary: Gets or sets the file name of the template used by the document.

remarks.p: This property is used by the field if the property is empty.
If this property is empty, the default template file name Normal.dotm is used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.ResultFormatter
member.summary: Allows to control how the field result is formatted.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldOptions.BuiltInTemplatesPaths
member.summary: Gets or sets paths of MS Word built-in templates.

remarks.p: This property is used by the and fields, if referenced auto text entry is not found in the template.

By default MS Word stores built-in templates in c:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Document Building Blocks\1033\16\Built-In Building Blocks.dotx and C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Templates\Normal.dotm files.

Implements the NEXT field.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fields documentation article.
member.remarks: Merges the next data record into the current resulting merged document, rather than starting a new merged document.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldNextIf
member.summary:
Implements the NEXTIF field.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fields documentation article.
member.remarks: Compares the values designated by the expressions and in comparison using the operator designated by . If the comparison is true, the next data record is merged into the current merge document. (Merge fields that follow the NEXTIF in the main document are replaced by values from the next data record rather than the current data record.) If the comparison is false, the next data record is merged into a new merge document.

member.summary: Gets or sets the left part of the comparison expression.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField
member.summary:
Represents a single form field.
To learn more, visit the Working with Form Fields documentation article.

remarks.p: Microsoft Word provides the following form fields: checkbox, text input and dropdown (combobox).
is an inline-node and can only be a child of .
is represented in a document by a special character and positioned as a character within a line of text.

A complete form field in a Word document is a complex structure represented by several nodes: field start, field code such as FORMTEXT, form field data, field separator, field result, field end and a bookmark. To programmatically create form fields in a Word document use , and which make sure all of the form field nodes are created in a correct order and in a suitable state.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Calls .
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the node.
member.returns: false if the visitor requested the enumeration to stop.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.RemoveField
member.summary: Removes the complete form field, not just the form field special character.
member.remarks: If there is a bookmark associated with the form field, the bookmark is not removed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.SetTextInputValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Applies the text format specified in and stores the value in .
member.param: Can be a string, number or a DateTime object.
member.remarks: The value is applied if is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.NodeType
member.summary: Returns .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the form field name.
member.remarks: Microsoft Word allows strings with at most 20 characters.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.Type
member.summary: Returns the form field type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.Result
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that represents the result of this form field.

remarks.p: For a text form field the result is the text that is in the field.
For a checkbox form field the result can be "1" or "0" to indicate checked or unchecked.
For a dropdown form field the result is the string selected in the dropdown.
Setting for a text form field does not apply the text format specified in . If you want to set a value and apply the format, use the method.
For a text form field the value is applied if is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.StatusText
member.summary: Returns or sets the text that's displayed in the status bar when a form field has the focus.

remarks.p: If the property is set to true, the property specifies the status bar text. If the property is set to false, the property specifies the name of an AutoText entry that contains status bar text for the form field.
Microsoft Word allows strings with at most 138 characters.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.OwnStatus
member.summary: Specifies the source of the text that's displayed in the status bar when a form field has the focus.

remarks.p: If true, the text specified by the property is displayed. If false, the text of the AutoText entry specified by the property is displayed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.HelpText
member.summary: Returns or sets the text that's displayed in a message box when the form field has the focus and the user presses F1.

remarks.p: If the property is set to true, specifies the text string value. If is set to false, specifies the name of an AutoText entry that contains help text for the form field.
Microsoft Word allows strings with at most 255 characters.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.OwnHelp
member.summary: Specifies the source of the text that's displayed in a message box when a form field has the focus and the user presses F1.

remarks.p: If true, the text specified by the property is displayed. If false, the text in the AutoText entry specified by the property is displayed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.CalculateOnExit
member.summary: True if references to the specified form field are automatically updated whenever the field is exited.

remarks.p: Setting only affects the behavior of the form field when the document is opened in Microsoft Word. Aspose.Words never updates references to the form field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.EntryMacro
member.summary: Returns or sets an entry macro name for the form field.

remarks.p: The entry macro runs when the form field gets the focus in Microsoft Word.
Microsoft Word allows strings with at most 32 characters.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.ExitMacro
member.summary: Returns or sets an exit macro name for the form field.

remarks.p: The exit macro runs when the form field loses the focus in Microsoft Word.
Microsoft Word allows strings with at most 32 characters.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.Enabled
member.summary: True if a form field is enabled.

remarks.p: If a form field is enabled, its contents can be changed as the form is filled in.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.TextInputFormat
member.summary: Returns or sets the text formatting for a text form field.

remarks.p: If the text form field contains regular text, then valid format strings are "", "UPPERCASE", "LOWERCASE", "FIRST CAPITAL" and "TITLE CASE". The strings are case-insensitive.
If the text form field contains a number or a date/time value, then valid format strings are number or date and time format strings.
Microsoft Word allows strings with at most 64 characters.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.TextInputType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of a text form field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.TextInputDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets the default string or a calculation expression of a text form field.

remarks.para: The meaning of this property depends on the value of the property.
When is or , this string specifies the default string for the text form field. This string is the content that Microsoft Word will display in the document when the form field is empty.

When is , then this string holds the expression to be calculated. The expression needs to be a formula valid according to Microsoft Word formula field requirements. When you set a new expression using this property, Aspose.Words calculates the formula result automatically and inserts it into the form field.
Microsoft Word allows strings with at most 255 characters.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.MaxLength
member.summary: Maximum length for the text field. Zero when the length is not limited.

remarks.p: Applicable for a check box form field only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormFieldCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a form field at the specified index.

remarks.p: The index is zero-based.
Negative indexes are allowed and indicate access from the back of the collection. For example -1 means the last item, -2 means the second before last and so on.
If index is greater than or equal to the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.
If index is negative and its absolute value is greater than the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.

member.param: An index into the collection.

member.summary: Returns a form field by bookmark name.
member.remarks: Returns null if the form field with the specified bookmark name cannot be found.
member.param: Case-insensitive bookmark name.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fields.Field
member.summary:
Represents a Microsoft Word document field.
To learn more, visit the Working with Fields documentation article.

remarks.para: A field in a Word document is a complex structure consisting of multiple nodes that include field start, field code, field separator, field result and field end. Fields can be nested, contain rich content and span multiple paragraphs or sections in a document. The class is a "facade" object that provides properties and methods that allow to work with a field as a single object.
The , and properties point to the field start, separator and end nodes of the field respectively.

The content between the field start and separator is the field code. The content between the field separator and field end is the field result. The field code typically consists of one or more objects that specify instructions. The processing application is expected to execute the field code to calculate the field result.

The process of calculating field results is called the field update. Aspose.Words can update field results of most of the field types in exactly the same way as Microsoft Word does it. Most notably, Aspose.Words can calculate results of even the most complex formula fields. To calculate the field result of a single field use the method. To update fields in the whole document use .

You can get the plain text version of the field code using the method. You can get and set the plain text version of the field result using the property. Both the field code and field result can contain complex content, such as nested fields, paragraphs, shapes, tables and in this case you might want to work with the field nodes directly if you need more control.
You do not create instances of the class directly. To create a new field use the method.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fields.Field.GetFieldCode
member.summary: Returns text between field start and field separator (or field end if there is no separator). Both field code and field result of child fields are included.

member.summary: Returns text between field start and field separator (or field end if there is no separator).
member.param: true if child field codes should be included.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Fields.Field.Remove
member.summary: Removes the field from the document. Returns a node right after the field. If the field's end is the last child of its parent node, returns its parent paragraph. If the field is already removed, returns null.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Fill
member.summary:
Represents fill formatting for an object.
To learn more, visit the Working with Graphic Elements documentation article.

remarks.p: Use the or property to access fill properties of an object. You do not create instances of the class directly.

member.dev: This class is proposed public facade for . https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office/vba/api/word.fillformat

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.HorizontalRuleFormat
member.summary:
Represents horizontal rule formatting.
To learn more, visit the Working with Shapes documentation article.
member.dev: FIX 18182. This class has been added to provide public horizontal rule properties.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.HorizontalRuleFormat.WidthPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the specified horizontal rule expressed as a percentage of the window width.

remarks.p: Valid values ​​range from 1 to 100 inclusive.
The default value is 100.

member.exception: Throws when argument was out of the range of valid values.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.HorizontalRuleFormat.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the horizontal rule.

remarks.p: This is a shortcut to the property.
Valid values ​​range from 0 to 1584 inclusive.
The default value is 1.5.

member.exception: Throws when argument was out of the range of valid values.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.HorizontalRuleFormat.NoShade
member.summary: Indicates the presence of 3D shading for the horizontal rule. If true, then the horizontal rule is without 3D shading and solid color is used.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.HorizontalRuleFormat.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush color that fills the horizontal rule.

remarks.p: This is a shortcut to the property.
The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.HorizontalRuleFormat.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the horizontal rule.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.OlePackage
member.summary:
Allows to access OLE Package properties.
To learn more, visit the Working with Ole Objects documentation article.
member.remarks: OLE package is a legacy and "undocumented" way to store embedded object if OLE handler is unknown. Early Windows versions such as Windows 3.1, 95 and 98 had Packager.exe application which could be used to embed any type of data into document. Now this application is excluded from Windows but MS Word and other applications still use it to embed data if OLE handler is missing or unknown.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.OlePackage.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets OLE Package file name.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.OlePackage.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets or sets OLE Package display name.

summary.para: The Aspose.Words.Drawing namespace provides classes that allow to create and modify drawing objects.

All drawing objects in Microsoft Word documents are represented by instances of the and classes. An object of the class is a node in a document and can represent a picture, textbox, AutoShape or an OLE object.
The classes in this namespace support the latest (Word 2007 - 2013 DrawingML) and the earlier (pre Word 2007 - Office Art) shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeMarkupLanguage.Dml
member.summary: Drawing Markup Language is used to define the shape.
member.remarks: This is the new standard for drawing for Office Open XML which has appeared first in ECMA-376 1st edition (2006), first appeared in MS Word 2007.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeMarkupLanguage.Vml
member.summary: Vector Markup Language is used to define the shape.
member.remarks: A deprecated format included in Office Open XML for legacy reasons only.

member.summary:
Provides access to signature line properties.
To learn more, visit the Work with Digital Signatures documentation article.

member.summary: Gets or sets suggested signer of the signature line. Default value for this property is empty string ().

member.summary: Gets or sets suggested signer's title (for example, Manager). Default value for this property is empty string ().

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.SignatureLine.Email
member.summary: Gets or sets suggested signer's e-mail address. Default value for this property is empty string ().

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that default instructions is shown in the Sign dialog. Default value for this property is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.SignatureLine.Instructions
member.summary: Gets or sets instructions to the signer that are displayed on signing the signature line. This property is ignored if is set. Default value for this property is empty string ().

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.SignatureLine.AllowComments
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the signer can add comments in the Sign dialog. Default value for this property is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.SignatureLine.ShowDate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that sign date is shown in the signature line. Default value for this property is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.SignatureLine.Id
member.summary:
Gets or sets identifier for this signature line.
This identifier can be associated with a digital signature, when signing document using . This value must be unique and by default it is randomly generated new Guid ().

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.SignatureLine.ProviderId
member.summary: Gets or sets signature provider identifier for this signature line. Default value is "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

remarks.para: The cryptographic service provider (CSP) is an independent software module that actually performs cryptography algorithms for authentication, encoding, and encryption. MS Office reserves the value of {00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000} for its default signature provider.
The GUID of the additionally installed provider should be obtained from the documentation shipped with the provider.

In addition, all the installed cryptographic providers are enumerated in windows registry. It can be found in the following path: HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Cryptography\Defaults\Provider. There is a key name "CP Service UUID" which corresponds to a GUID of signature provider.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.SignatureLine.IsSigned
member.summary: Indicates that signature line is signed by digital signature.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.SignatureLine.IsValid
member.summary: Indicates that signature line is signed by digital signature and this digital signature is valid.

Each defines a new coordinate system for its child shapes. The coordinate system is defined using the and properties.

You should specify desired shape properties after you created a shape.

member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.
member.remarks: Calls , then calls for all child shapes of this group shape and calls at the end.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData
member.summary:
Defines an image for a shape.
To learn more, visit the Working with Images documentation article.

remarks.p: Use the property to access and modify the image inside a shape. You do not create instances of the class directly.
An image can be stored inside a shape, linked to external file or both (linked and stored in the document).

Regardless of whether the image is stored inside the shape or linked, you can always access the actual image using the , , or methods. If the image is stored inside the shape, you can also directly access it using the property.
To store an image inside a shape use the method. To link an image to a shape, set the property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.SetImage(System.Drawing.Image)
member.summary: Sets the image that the shape displays.
member.param: The image object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.SetImage(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Sets the image that the shape displays.
member.param: The stream that contains the image.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.SetImage(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the image that the shape displays.
member.param: The image file. Can be a file name or a URL.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.ToImage
member.summary: Gets the image stored in the shape as a object.

remarks.p: A new object is created every time this method is called.
It is the responsibility of the caller to dispose the image object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.ToStream
member.summary: Creates and returns a stream that contains the image bytes.

remarks.p: If the image bytes are stored in the shape, creates and returns a object.
If the image is linked and stored in a file, opens the file and returns a object.
If the image is linked and stored in an external URL, downloads the file and returns a object.
Is it the responsibility of the caller to dispose the stream object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.ToByteArray
member.summary: Returns image bytes for any image regardless whether the image is stored or linked.

remarks.para: If the image is linked, downloads the image every time it is called.

member.summary: Saves the image into the specified stream.
member.param: The stream where to save the image to.
member.overloads: Saves the image of the shape.

remarks.p: Is it the responsibility of the caller to dispose the stream object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the image into a file.
member.param: The file name where to save the image.

remarks.para: Setting the value to null or an empty array will remove the image from the shape.

member.summary: Gets or sets the path and name of the source file for the linked image.

remarks.p: The default value is an empty string.
If is not an empty string, the image is linked.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.Title
member.summary: Defines the title of an image.

remarks.p: The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.CropTop
member.summary: Defines the fraction of picture removal from the top side.

remarks.p: The amount of cropping can range from -1.0 to 1.0. The default value is 0. Note that a value of 1 will display no picture at all. Negative values will result in the picture being squeezed inward from the edge being cropped (the empty space between the picture and the cropped edge will be filled by the fill color of the shape). Positive values less than 1 will result in the remaining picture being stretched to fit the shape.
The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.CropBottom
member.summary: Defines the fraction of picture removal from the bottom side.

remarks.p: The amount of cropping can range from -1.0 to 1.0. The default value is 0. Note that a value of 1 will display no picture at all. Negative values will result in the picture being squeezed inward from the edge being cropped (the empty space between the picture and the cropped edge will be filled by the fill color of the shape). Positive values less than 1 will result in the remaining picture being stretched to fit the shape.
The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.CropLeft
member.summary: Defines the fraction of picture removal from the left side.

remarks.p: The amount of cropping can range from -1.0 to 1.0. The default value is 0. Note that a value of 1 will display no picture at all. Negative values will result in the picture being squeezed inward from the edge being cropped (the empty space between the picture and the cropped edge will be filled by the fill color of the shape). Positive values less than 1 will result in the remaining picture being stretched to fit the shape.
The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.CropRight
member.summary: Defines the fraction of picture removal from the right side.

remarks.p: The amount of cropping can range from -1.0 to 1.0. The default value is 0. Note that a value of 1 will display no picture at all. Negative values will result in the picture being squeezed inward from the edge being cropped (the empty space between the picture and the cropped edge will be filled by the fill color of the shape). Positive values less than 1 will result in the remaining picture being stretched to fit the shape.
The default value is 0.

remarks.p: The default value is 0.

For example, if the source file is a Microsoft Excel workbook, the property might return "Workbook1!R3C1:R4C2" if the OLE object contains only a few cells from the worksheet.

member.summary: Specifies whether the link to the OLE object is automatically updated or not in Microsoft Word.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.OleFormat.OleIcon
member.summary: Gets the draw aspect of the OLE object. When true, the OLE object is displayed as an icon. When false, the OLE object is displayed as content.

remarks.para: Aspose.Words does not allow to set this property to avoid confusion. If you were able to change the draw aspect in Aspose.Words, Microsoft Word would still display the OLE object in its original draw aspect until you edit or update the OLE object in Microsoft Word.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.OleFormat.IsLocked

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.OleFormat.OlePackage
member.summary: Provide access to if OLE object is an OLE Package. Returns null otherwise.
member.remarks: OLE Package is a legacy technology that allows to wrap any file format not present in the OLE registry of a Windows system into a generic package allowing to embed almost anything into a document. See type for more info.
member.dev: Has meaning only if ProgId equal to "Package" otherwise is null.

member.summary: Gets objects if this OLE object is an ActiveX control. Otherwise this property is null.
member.dev: If value is binary OleObject and it contains Forms2OleControl, then it means we have unparsed Forms2OleControl in ShapePr[ShapeAttr.OleObject]. In this case we should parse it and replace with new parsed OleControl created from this unparsed OleObject.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Shape
member.summary:
Represents an object in the drawing layer, such as an AutoShape, textbox, freeform, OLE object, ActiveX control, or picture.
To learn more, visit the Working with Shapes documentation article.

remarks.p: Using the class you can create or modify shapes in a Microsoft Word document.

An important property of a shape is its . Shapes of different types can have different capabilities in a Word document. For example, only image and OLE shapes can have images inside them. Most of the shapes can have text, but not all.
Shapes that can have text, can contain and nodes as children.

member.summary: Ctor. Use this internally only.
member.param: The owner document.

member.summary: Ctor. Use this internally only. WORDSNET-11493 Implement possibility to create DML shapes by default.
member.param: The owner document.
Shape markup language: DrawingML or Vml
