remarks.p: You should specify desired shape properties after you created a shape.

member.param: The owner document.
The type of the shape to create.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Shape.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on .
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the nodes.
member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.
member.remarks: Calls , then calls for all child nodes of the shape and calls at the end.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Shape.Clone(System.Boolean,Aspose.Words.INodeCloningListener)
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of the node.

remarks.p: This method serves as a copy constructor for nodes. The cloned node has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original node.
This method always performs a deep copy of the node. The parameter specifies whether to perform copy all child nodes as well.

member.param: True to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; false to clone only the node itself.
Listener to node cloning event.
member.returns: The cloned node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Shape.UpdateSmartArtDrawing
member.summary: Updates SmartArt pre-rendered drawing by using Aspose.Words's SmartArt cold rendering engine.
member.remarks: Microsoft Word generates and saves the pre-rendered drawing along with SmartArt object. However, if the document is saved by other applications, the pre-rendered SmartArt drawing may be missing or incorrect. If pre-rendered drawing is available then Aspose.Words uses it to render the SmartArt object. If pre-rendered drawing is missing then Aspose.Words uses its own SmartArt cold rendering engine to render the SmartArt object. If pre-rendered drawing is incorrect then it is required to call this method to invoke the SmartArt cold rendering engine.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase
member.summary:
Base class for objects in the drawing layer, such as an AutoShape, freeform, OLE object, ActiveX control, or picture.
To learn more, visit the Working with Shapes documentation article.

remarks.p: This is an abstract class. The two derived classes that you can instantiate are and .
A shape is a node in the document tree.
If the shape is a child of a object, then the shape is said to be "top-level". Top-level shapes are measured and positioned in points.

A shape can also occur as a child of a object when several shapes are grouped. Child shapes of a group shape are positioned in the coordinate space and units defined by the and properties of the parent group shape.
A shape can be positioned inline with text or floating. The positioning method is controlled using the property.
When a shape is floating, it is positioned relative to something (e.g the current paragraph, the margin or the page). The relative positioning of the shape is specified using the and properties.
A floating shape be positioned explicitly using the and properties or aligned relative to some other object using the and properties.

member.summary: Specifies whether the shape's anchor is locked.

remarks.p: The default value is false.
Has effect only for top level shapes.
This property affects behavior of the shape's anchor in Microsoft Word. When the anchor is not locked, moving the shape in Microsoft Word can move the shape's anchor too.

remarks.para: This property affects behavior of the shape in Microsoft Word. Aspose.Words ignores the value of this property.

member.summary: Defines the angle (in degrees) that a shape is rotated. Positive value corresponds to clockwise rotation angle.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.ZOrder
member.summary: Determines the display order of overlapping shapes.

remarks.p: Has effect only for top level shapes.
The default value is 0.
The number represents the stacking precedence. A shape with a higher number will be displayed as if it were overlapping (in "front" of) a shape with a lower number.
The order of overlapping shapes is independent for shapes in the header and in the main text of the document.
The display order of child shapes in a group shape is determined by their order inside the group shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeLineStyle.Default
member.summary: Default value is .

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeType
member.summary: Specifies the type of shape in a Microsoft Word document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeType.Image
member.summary: The shape is an image.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeType.TextBox
member.summary: The shape is a textbox. Note that shapes of many other types can also have text inside them too. A shape does not have to have this type to contain text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeType.Group

summary.p: The shape is a group shape.

member.dev: In DOC file, shape group has shape type NonPrimitive, we don't want this in the model, so in the model it is our own constant.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeType.OleObject
member.summary:
The shape is an OLE object.
You cannot create shapes of this type in the document.
member.dev: In Microsoft Word, shapes that represent OLE objects have shape type picture, but in our model, they are distinguished into their own shape type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeType.OleControl
member.summary:
The shape is an ActiveX control.
You cannot create shapes of this type in the document.
member.dev: In DOC and RTF, shapes that represent ActiveX controls have shape type picture. In WordML, ActiveX controls have their own shape type and so is in the model.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeType.NonPrimitive
member.summary:
A shape drawn by user and consisting of multiple segments and/or vertices (curve, freeform or scribble).
You cannot create shapes of this type in the document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeType.CustomShape
member.summary:
This shape type seems to be set for shapes that are not part of the standard set of the auto shapes in Microsoft Word. For example, if you insert a new auto shape from ClipArt.
You cannot create shapes of this type in the document.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke
member.summary:
Defines a stroke for a shape.
To learn more, visit the Working with Shapes documentation article.

remarks.p: Use the property to access stroke properties of a shape. You do not create instances of the class directly.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.On
member.summary: Defines whether the path will be stroked.

remarks.p: The default value for a is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.Color
member.summary: Defines the color of a stroke.

remarks.p: The default value for a is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.Color2
member.summary: Defines a second color for a stroke.

remarks.p: The default value for a is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color of the stroke.
member.remarks: The default value for a is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the stroke.
member.remarks: The default value for a is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether the stroke is visible.
member.remarks: The default value for a is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.Transparency
member.summary: Gets or sets a value between 0.0 (opaque) and 1.0 (clear) representing the degree of transparency of the stroke.
member.remarks: The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.Weight
member.summary: Defines the brush thickness that strokes the path of a shape in points.

remarks.p: The default value for a is 0.75.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.DashStyle
member.summary: Specifies the dot and dash pattern for a stroke.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.JoinStyle
member.summary: Defines the join style of a polyline.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.EndCap
member.summary: Defines the cap style for the end of a stroke.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.LineStyle
member.summary: Defines the line style of the stroke.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.StartArrowType
member.summary: Defines the arrowhead for the start of a stroke.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.EndArrowType
member.summary: Defines the arrowhead for the end of a stroke.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.StartArrowWidth
member.summary: Defines the arrowhead width for the start of a stroke.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.StartArrowLength
member.summary: Defines the arrowhead length for the start of a stroke.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.EndArrowWidth
member.summary: Defines the arrowhead width for the end of a stroke.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.EndArrowLength
member.summary: Defines the arrowhead length for the end of a stroke.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.Opacity
member.summary: Defines the amount of transparency of a stroke. Valid range is from 0 to 1.

remarks.p: The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.ImageBytes
member.summary: Defines the image for a stroke image or pattern fill.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Stroke.Fill
member.summary: Gets fill formatting for the .

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox
member.summary:
Defines attributes that specify how a text is displayed inside a shape.
To learn more, visit the Working with Shapes documentation article.

remarks.p: Use the property to access text properties of a shape. You do not create instances of the class directly.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox.IsValidLinkTarget(Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox)
member.summary: Determines whether this can be linked to the target .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox.BreakForwardLink
member.summary: Breaks the link to the next .
member.remarks: doesn't break all other links in the current sequence of shapes. For example: 1-2-3-4 sequence and at the 2-nd textbox will create two sequences 1-2, 3-4.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox.InternalMarginLeft
member.summary: Specifies the inner left margin in points for a shape.

remarks.p: The default value is 1/10 inch.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox.InternalMarginRight
member.summary: Specifies the inner right margin in points for a shape.

remarks.p: The default value is 1/10 inch.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox.InternalMarginTop
member.summary: Specifies the inner top margin in points for a shape.

remarks.p: The default value is 1/20 inch.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox.InternalMarginBottom
member.summary: Specifies the inner bottom margin in points for a shape.

remarks.p: The default value is 1/20 inch.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox.FitShapeToText
member.summary: Determines whether Microsoft Word will grow the shape to fit text.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox.LayoutFlow
member.summary: Determines the flow of the text layout in a shape.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox.TextBoxWrapMode
member.summary: Determines how text wraps inside a shape.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox.NoTextRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating either text of the TextBox should not rotate when the shape is rotated.

remarks.p: The default value is false

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox.VerticalAnchor
member.summary: Specifies the vertical alignment of the text within a shape.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox.Next
member.summary: Returns or sets a that represents the next in a sequence of shapes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox.Previous
member.summary: Returns a that represents the previous in a sequence of shapes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextBox.Parent
member.summary: Gets a parent shape for the .

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath
member.summary:
Defines the text and formatting of the text path (of a WordArt object).
To learn more, visit the Working with Shapes documentation article.

remarks.p: Use the property to access WordArt properties of a shape. You do not create instances of the class directly.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.On
member.summary: Defines whether the text is displayed.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.FitPath
member.summary: Defines whether the text fits the path of a shape.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.FitShape
member.summary: Defines whether the text fits bounding box of a shape.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.FontFamily
member.summary: Defines the family of the textpath font.

remarks.p: The default value is Arial.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Size
member.summary: Defines the size of the font in points.

remarks.p: The default value is 36.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Bold
member.summary: True if the font is formatted as bold.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Italic
member.summary: True if the font is formatted as italic.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.SmallCaps
member.summary: True if the font is formatted as small capital letters.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.RotateLetters
member.summary: Determines whether the letters of the text are rotated.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Trim
member.summary: Determines whether extra space is removed above and below the text.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Kerning
member.summary: Determines whether kerning is turned on.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Shadow
member.summary: Defines whether a shadow is applied to the text on a text path.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Underline
member.summary: True if the font is underlined.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.StrikeThrough
member.summary: True if the font is formatted as strikethrough text.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.SameLetterHeights
member.summary: Determines whether all letters will be the same height regardless of initial case.

remarks.p: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Text
member.summary: Defines the text of the text path.

remarks.p: The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.TextPathAlignment
member.summary: Defines the alignment of text.

remarks.p: The default value is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.ReverseRows
member.summary: Determines whether the layout order of rows is reversed.

remarks.p: The default value is false.
If true, the layout order of rows is reversed. This attribute is used for vertical text layout.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.Spacing
member.summary: Defines the amount of spacing for text. 1 means 100%.

remarks.p: The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPath.XScale
member.summary: Determines whether a straight textpath will be used instead of the shape path.

remarks.p: The default value is false.
If true, the text runs along a path from left to right along the x value of the lower boundary of the shape.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPathAlignment
member.summary: WordArt alignment.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPathAlignment.Stretch
member.summary: Stretch each line of text to fit width.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPathAlignment.Center
member.summary: Center text on width.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPathAlignment.Left
member.summary: Left justify.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPathAlignment.Right
member.summary: Right justify.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPathAlignment.LetterJustify
member.summary: Spread letters out to fit width.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.TextPathAlignment.WordJustify
member.summary: Spread words out to fit width.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Specifies vertical alignment of a floating shape, text frame or a floating table.
member.dev: Do not renumber. The values are taken from the RTF specification.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.None
member.summary: The object is explicitly positioned, usually using its Top property.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.Top
member.summary: Specifies that the object shall be at the top of the vertical alignment base.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that the object shall be centered with respect to the vertical alignment base.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.Bottom
member.summary: Specifies that the object shall be at the bottom of the vertical alignment base.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.Inside
member.summary: Specifies that the object shall be inside of the horizontal alignment base.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.Outside
member.summary: Specifies that the object shall be outside of the vertical alignment base.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.Inline
member.summary: Not documented. Seems to be a possible value for floating paragraphs and tables.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.VerticalAlignment.Default
member.summary: Same as .

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapSide
member.summary: Specifies what side(s) of the shape or picture the text wraps around.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapSide.Both
member.summary: The document text wraps on both sides of the shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapSide.Left
member.summary: The document text wraps on the left side of the shape only. There is a text free area on the right of the shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapSide.Right
member.summary: The document text wraps on the right side of the shape only. There is a text free area on the left side of the shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapSide.Largest
member.summary: The document text wraps on the side of the shape that is farthest from the page margin, leaving text free area on the other side of the shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapSide.Default
member.summary: Default value is .

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapType
member.summary: Specifies how text is wrapped around a shape or picture.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapType.None
member.summary: No text wrapping around the shape. The shape is placed behind or in front of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapType.Inline
member.summary: The shape remains on the same layer as text and treated as a character.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapType.TopBottom
member.summary: The text stops at the top of the shape and restarts on the line below the shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapType.Square
member.summary: Wraps text around all sides of the square bounding box of the shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapType.Tight
member.summary: Wraps tightly around the edges of the shape, instead of wrapping around the bounding box.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Drawing.WrapType.Through
member.summary: Same as Tight, but wraps inside any parts of the shape that are open.

summary.p: The Aspose.Words.Drawing namespace contains classes that allow to create and modify drawing objects in Microsoft Word documents.
Aspose.Words supports all drawing objects in Microsoft Word documents, including OfficeArt shapes, textboxes, pictures, diagrams, OLE objects and ActiveX controls.
The main classes in this namespace are:

list.item: represents an object in the drawing layer, such as an AutoShape, textbox, freeform, OLE object, ActiveX control, or picture.
represents a group of shapes in a document.
is the base class for the shape and group shape classes, provides all common shape properties such as position, size and text wrapping. A shape is a node in the document tree.

summary.p: Although not every type of drawing object can be programmatically created and not every shape property can be accessed, all drawing objects are fully preserved in Microsoft Word documents during document open-save operations.
Names of classes, methods and properties in this namespace correspond to VML DOM where possible.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Charts.ChartNumberFormat
member.summary:
Represents number formatting of the parent element.
To learn more, visit the Working with Charts documentation article.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Charts.ChartNumberFormat.FormatCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the format code applied to a data label.
member.remarks:
Number formatting is used to change the way a value appears in data label and can be used in some very creative ways. The examples of number formats:
Number - "#,##0.00"
Currency - "\"$\"#,##0.00"
Time - "[$-x-systime]h:mm:ss AM/PM"
Date - "d/mm/yyyy"
Percentage - "0.00%"
Fraction - "# ?/?"
Scientific - "0.00E+00"
Text - "@"
Accounting - "_-\"$\"* #,##0.00_-;-\"$\"* #,##0.00_-;_-\"$\"* \"-\"??_-;_-@_-"
Custom with color - "[Red]-#,##0.0"

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Charts.ChartNumberFormat.IsLinkedToSource
member.summary: Specifies whether the format code is linked to a source cell. Default is true.
member.remarks: The NumberFormat will be reset to general if format code is linked to source.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Charts.ChartSeriesCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a at the specified index.

remarks.p: The index is zero-based.
Negative indexes are allowed and indicate access from the back of the collection. For example -1 means the last item, -2 means the second before last and so on.
If index is greater than or equal to the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.
If index is negative and its absolute value is greater than the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.

member.param: An index into the collection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.Charts.ChartAxis.CrossesAt
member.summary: Specifies where on the perpendicular axis the axis crosses.

remarks.para: The property has effect only if are set to . It is not supported by MS Office 2016 new charts.

The units are determined by the type of axis. When the axis is a value axis, the value of the property is a decimal number on the value axis. When the axis is a time category axis, the value is defined as an integer number of days relative to the base date (30/12/1899). For a text category axis, the value is an integer category number, starting with 1 as the first category.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Layout.IPageLayoutCallback
member.summary: Implement this interface if you want to have your own custom method called during build and rendering of page layout model.
member.remarks:
The primary use for this interface is to allow application code to abort build process.
It is possible to build page layout model for only a few pages at start of the document then abort process and render only what has been built already.
Note, however, that rendering results may not match what would be rendered for each page if process would have finished.
This technique may not work for every document or may fail completely.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.IPageLayoutCallback.Notify(Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutCallbackArgs)
member.summary: This is called to notify of layout build and rendering progress.
member.param: An argument of the event.
member.remarks: Exception when thrown by implementation aborts layout build process.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutCallbackArgs
member.summary:
An argument passed into
To learn more, visit the Converting to Fixed-page Format documentation article.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutCallbackArgs.Event
member.summary: Gets event.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutCallbackArgs.Document
member.summary: Gets document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutCallbackArgs.PageIndex
member.summary: Gets 0-based index of the page in the document this event relates to. Returns negative value if there is no associated page, or if page was removed during reflow.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutEvent
member.summary:
A code of event raised during page layout model build and rendering.
Page layout model is built in two steps. First, "conversion step", this is when page layout pulls document content and creates object graph. Second, "reflow step", this is when structures are split, merged and arranged into pages.
Depending of the operation which triggered build, page layout model may or may not be further rendered into fixed page format. For example, computing number of pages in the document or updating fields does not require rendering, whereas export to Pdf does.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutEvent.None
member.summary: Default value

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutEvent.WatchDog
member.summary:
Corresponds to a checkpoint in code which is often visited and which is suitable to abort process.
While inside throw custom exception to abort process.
You can throw when handling any callback event to abort process.
Note that if process is aborted the page layout model remains in undefined state. If process is aborted upon reflow of a complete page, however, it should be possible to use layout model up to the end of that page.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutEvent.BuildStarted
member.summary: Build of the page layout has started. Fired once. This is the first event which occurs when is called.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutEvent.BuildFinished
member.summary: Build of the page layout has finished. Fired once. This is the last event which occurs when is called.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutEvent.ConversionStarted
member.summary: Conversion of document model to page layout has started. Fired once. This occurs when layout model starts pulling document content.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutEvent.ConversionFinished
member.summary: Conversion of document model to page layout has finished. Fired once. This occurs when layout model stops pulling document content.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutEvent.ReflowStarted
member.summary: Reflow of the page layout has started. Fired once. This occurs when layout model starts reflowing document content.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutEvent.ReflowFinished
member.summary: Reflow of the page layout has finished. Fired once. This occurs when layout model stops reflowing document content.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Layout.PageLayoutEvent.PartReflowStarted

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutOptions
member.summary:
Holds the options that allow controlling the document layout process.
To learn more, visit the Converting to Fixed-page Format documentation article.

remarks.para: You do not create instances of this class directly. Use the property to access layout options for this document.
Note that after changing any of the options present in this class, method should be called in order for the changed options to be applied to the layout.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutOptions.RevisionOptions
member.summary: Gets revision options.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutOptions.ShowHiddenText
member.summary: Gets or sets indication of whether hidden text in the document is rendered. Default is false.
member.remarks: This property affects all hidden content, not just text.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutOptions.ShowParagraphMarks
member.summary: Gets or sets indication of whether paragraph marks are rendered. Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutOptions.CommentDisplayMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the way comments are rendered. Default value is .
member.remarks: Note that revisions are not rendered in balloons for .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutOptions.TextShaperFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets implementation used for Advanced Typography rendering features.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutOptions.Callback
member.summary: Gets or sets implementation used by page layout model.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutOptions.IgnorePrinterMetrics
member.summary: Gets or sets indication of whether the "Use printer metrics to lay out document" compatibility option is ignored. Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutOptions.ContinuousSectionPageNumberingRestart
member.summary: Gets or sets the mode of behavior for computing page numbers when a continuous section restarts the page numbering.
member.remarks: The default value is . It matches the behavior of MS Word 2019 which was the latest version at the moment the option was introduced. Older page numbering logic demonstrated by MS Word 2016 is available via this option. Please for the behavior description.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector

summary.para: This class allows to compute page numbers of document nodes.
To learn more, visit the Converting to Fixed-page Format documentation article.

remarks.para: When you create a and specify a document object to attach to, the collector will record mapping of document nodes to layout objects when the document is formatted into pages.

You will be able to find out on which page a particular document node (e.g. run, paragraph or table cell) is located by using the , and methods. These methods automatically build page layout model of the document and update fields if required.
When you no longer need to collect layout information, it is best to set the property to null to avoid unnecessary collection of more layout mappings.

member.dev: !!! DO NOT USE THIS CLASS INTERNALLY IN AW. CONTACT LAYOUT TEAM FOR YOUR CUSTOM SOLUTION FIRST !!!

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector.#ctor(Aspose.Words.Document)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of this class.
member.param: The document to which this collector instance will be attached to.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector.GetStartPageIndex(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Gets 1-based index of the page where node begins. Returns 0 if node cannot be mapped to a page.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector.GetEndPageIndex(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Gets 1-based index of the page where node ends. Returns 0 if node cannot be mapped to a page.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector.GetNumPagesSpanned(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Gets number of pages the specified node spans. 0 if node is within a single page. This is the same as - .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector.Clear
member.summary: Clears all collected layout data. Call this method after document was manually updated, or layout was rebuilt.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector.GetEntity(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Returns an opaque position of the which corresponds to the specified node. You can use returned value as an argument to given the document being enumerated and the document of the node are the same.

remarks.para: This method works for only nodes, as well as indivisible inline nodes, e.g. or . It doesn't work for , or nodes, and nodes within header/footer.
Note that the entity returned for a node is a paragraph break span. Use the appropriate method to ascend to the parent line
If you need to navigate to a of text then you can insert bookmark right before it and then navigate to the bookmark instead.
If you need to navigate to a node then you can move to a node in this cell and then ascend to a parent entity. The same approach can be used for and nodes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutCollector.Document
member.summary: Gets or sets the document this collector instance is attached to.
member.remarks: If you need to access page indexes of the document nodes you need to set this property to point to a document instance, before page layout of the document is built. It is best to set this property to null afterwards, otherwise the collector continues to accumulate information from subsequent rebuilds of the document's page layout.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator
member.summary:
Enumerates page layout entities of a document.
You can use this class to walk over the page layout model. Available properties are type, geometry, text and page index where entity is rendered, as well as overall structure and relationships. Use combination of and move to the entity which corresponds to a document node.
To learn more, visit the Converting to Fixed-page Format documentation article.
member.dev: The design idea of this class is to represent all layout content in a single enumeration. This means that all stories of the document, including comments and footnotes/endnotes are accessible from elements on pages. For this reason avoid extending interface of this class but rather make changes to , and to integrate whatever content you need into single enumeration.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.#ctor(Aspose.Words.Document)
member.summary: Initializes new instance of this class.
member.param: A document whose page layout model to enumerate.

remarks.para: If page layout model of the document hasn't been built the enumerator calls to build it.
Whenever document is updated and new page layout model is created, a new enumerator must be used to access it.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Reset
member.summary: Moves the enumerator to the first page of the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MoveNext
member.summary:
Moves to the next sibling entity in visual order.
When iterating lines of a paragraph broken across pages this method will not move to the next page but rather move to the next entity on the same page.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MoveNextLogical
member.summary:
Moves to the next sibling entity in a logical order.
When iterating lines of a paragraph broken across pages this method will move to the next line even if it resides on another page.
member.remarks: Note that all entities are linked together thus if entity is span repeated calling of this method will iterates complete story of the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MovePrevious
member.summary: Moves to the previous sibling entity.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MovePreviousLogical
member.summary:
Moves to the previous sibling entity in a logical order.
When iterating lines of a paragraph broken across pages this method will move to the previous line even if it resides on another page.
member.remarks: Note that all entities are linked together thus if entity is span repeated calling of this method will iterates complete story of the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MoveFirstChild
member.summary: Moves to the first child entity.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MoveLastChild
member.summary: Moves to the last child entity.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MoveParent
member.summary: Moves to the parent entity.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.MoveParent(Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEntityType)
member.summary: Moves to the parent entity of the specified type.
member.param: The parent entity type to move to. Use bitwise-OR to specify multiple parent types.
member.remarks: This method is useful if you need to find the cell, column or header/footer parent of the entity.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of the current entity.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Rectangle
member.summary: Returns the bounding rectangle of the current entity relative to the page top left corner (in points).

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Kind
member.summary: Gets the kind of the current entity. This can be an empty string but never null.
member.remarks: This is a more specific type of the current entity, e.g. bookmark span has type and may have either a BOOKMARKSTART or BOOKMARKEND kind.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Text
member.summary: Gets text of the current span entity. Throws for other entity types.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.PageIndex
member.summary: Gets the 1-based index of a page which contains the current entity.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Current
member.summary: Gets or sets current position in the page layout model. This property returns an opaque object which corresponds to the current layout entity.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Document
member.summary: Gets document this instance enumerates.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Layout.LayoutEnumerator.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a named property of the entity.
member.param: A name of the property (case-sensitive).
member.returns: Null if property is not available, otherwise value of the property.
member.remarks: This is currently used to get font properties of spans. See class for possible properties names. Not all properties are supported.

summary.p: The Aspose.Words.Layout namespace provides classes that allow to access information such as on what page and where on a page particular document elements are positioned, when the document is formatted into pages.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature
member.summary: Features provide information about how glyphs are used in a font to render a script. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/featuretags

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature.GlyphCompositionDecomposition
member.summary: To minimize the number of glyph alternates, it is sometimes desirable to decompose the default glyph for a character into two or more glyphs. Additionally, it may be preferable to compose default glyphs for two or more characters into a single glyph for better glyph processing. This feature permits such composition/decomposition. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_ae#ccmp Equivalent OpenType tag: 'ccmp'

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature.StandardLigatures
member.summary: Replaces a sequence of glyphs with a single glyph which is preferred for typographic purposes. This feature covers the ligatures which the designer/manufacturer judges should be used in normal conditions. Equivalent OpenType tag: 'liga' https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_ko#liga

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature.RequiredLigatures
member.summary: Replaces a sequence of glyphs with a single glyph which is preferred for typographic purposes. This feature covers those ligatures, which the script determines as required to be used in normal conditions. This feature is important for some scripts to ensure correct glyph formation. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_pt#rlig Equivalent OpenType tag: 'rlig'

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature.ContextualLigatures
member.summary: Replaces a sequence of glyphs with a single glyph which is preferred for typographic purposes. Unlike other ligature features, 'clig' specifies the context in which the ligature is recommended. This capability is important in some script designs and for swash ligatures. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_ae#clig Equivalent OpenType tag: 'clig'

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature.DiscretionaryLigatures
member.summary: Replaces a sequence of glyphs with a single glyph which is preferred for typographic purposes. This feature covers those ligatures which may be used for special effect, at the user’s preference. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_ae#dlig Equivalent OpenType tag: 'dlig'

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature.HistoricalLigatures
member.summary: Some ligatures were in common use in the past, but appear anachronistic today. Some fonts include the historical forms as alternates, so they can be used for a "period" effect. This feature replaces the default (current) forms with the historical alternates. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_fj#hlig Equivalent OpenType tag: 'hlig'

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature.ProportionalFigures
member.summary: Replaces figure glyphs set on uniform (tabular) widths with corresponding glyphs set on glyph-specific (proportional) widths. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_pt#tag-pnum Equivalent OpenType tag: 'pnum'

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature.TabularFigures
member.summary: Replaces figure glyphs set on proportional widths with corresponding glyphs set on uniform (tabular) widths. Tabular widths will generally be the default, but this cannot be safely assumed. Of course this feature would not be present in monospaced designs. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_pt#tag-tnum Equivalent OpenType tag: 'tnum'

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature.LiningFigures
member.summary: This feature changes selected non-lining figures to lining figures. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_ko#lnum Equivalent OpenType tag: 'lnum'

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature.OldstyleFigures
member.summary: This feature changes selected figures from the default or lining style to oldstyle form. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_ko#onum Equivalent OpenType tag: 'onum'

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature.VerticalAlternates
member.summary: Transforms default glyphs into glyphs that are appropriate for upright presentation in vertical writing mode. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_uz#tag-vert Equivalent OpenType tag: 'vert'

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature.VerticalAlternatesAndRotation
member.summary: Replaces some fixed-width (half-, third- or quarter-width) or proportional-width glyphs (mostly Latin or katakana) with forms suitable for vertical writing (that is, rotated 90 degrees clockwise). https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_uz#tag-vrt2 Equivalent OpenType tag: 'vrt2'

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature.StylisticSet01
member.summary: Stylistic Set 1 In addition to, or instead of, stylistic alternatives of individual glyphs (see 'salt' feature), some fonts may contain sets of stylistic variant glyphs corresponding to portions of the character set, e.g. multiple variants for lowercase letters in a Latin font. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_pt#tag-ss01---ss20 Equivalent OpenType tag: 'ss01'

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.FontFeature.Kerning
member.summary: Adjusts amount of space between glyphs, generally to provide optically consistent spacing between glyphs. Although a well-designed typeface has consistent inter-glyph spacing overall, some glyph combinations require adjustment for improved legibility. Besides standard adjustment in the horizontal direction, this feature can supply size-dependent kerning data via device tables, "cross-stream" kerning in the Y text direction, and adjustment of glyph placement independent of the advance adjustment. Note that this feature may apply to runs of more than two glyphs, and would not be used in monospaced fonts. Also note that this feature does not apply to text set vertically. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/features_ko#kern Equivalent OpenType tag: 'kern'

member.summary: Returns objects generated from a sequence of text fragments. Length of the returned array is equal to length of . If run at an index has corresponding clusters then result at the same index will have them recorded.
member.param: A sequence of text fragments
A direction of text
A script
A set of features to consider

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Shaping.ScriptShapingLevel
member.summary: Describes shaping levels required by a script.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.ScriptShapingLevel.None
member.summary: Script does not require shaping.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.ScriptShapingLevel.Unknown
member.summary: This is used when the level for the script is not specified.
member.remarks: It should not happen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.ScriptShapingLevel.Minimum
member.summary: Script requires minimum shaping support.
member.remarks: It is not clear, what Minimum means. Minimum is set for some very popular scripts (Latin, Cyrillic...).

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.Shaping.ScriptShapingLevel.Full
member.summary: Script requires full shaping support.
